Title: How Crocs Changed My Life
Review: I will admit, I once was a hater. I lived a hateful negative life where I truly despised this footwear. But recently I've made many drastic life changes and these shoes have helped me see the light. They have helped me to see the beauty of the world and give me the confidence to face whatever obstacles life may throw my way. I can now walk outside with confidence. These shoes, these marvelous shoes, help me to live my life to the fullest not only in style but with such comfort no amount of words can begin to describe. I will now continue to live my life with an open mind to such fashion statements. No more will I live with my head hung low, but now I wear my crocs with pride. Sports mode empowers me while relaxed mode truly is the epitome of serenity. Crocs have also been the glue that has bonded me and one my best friends. Crocs truly change your life and bring people together. I will forever be indebted to this spectacular shoe.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2019

Title: Call me a Croc Enthusiast!!
Review: I LOVE THESE THINGS!! They're stylish and functional. These shoes are the future. It is not hard to pull them off with any outfit. Wear them to school, wear them to run errands, wear them to church! I sure do! Nothing can compare to these wonderful shoes.These shoes really show individuality. With a variety of colors and endless shoe charms, you can express who you are in a unique and fashionable way. Be a trend setter with Crocs, the shoes that should have never gone out of style!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2017

Title: Freesail vs Classic
Review: I own 2 pair of Crocs women's Freesail and figured I'd try a pair of the classics.  The Freesail are much trimmer & narrower in width than the  women's Classics.  I love both.  The Classics are quite a bit boxier and wider in width  than the Freesail and the Classics seem to have a bit more  cushioning on the bottom.  Both work well for my problem feet which are usually sporting the Alegria brand shoes/sandals  for work.  However, on weekends and downtime, I prefer Crocs.  I have hammer toes  and deteriorating foot joints and have lost most of natural cushioning on the bottom of my feet making it feel like I'm walking on marbles. I typically wear a women's 8/12 or a European size  39.  In Crocs, I always  go a size 9 for the length.  I love both the Freesail and Classics and would urge anyone with "touchy feet" to give these a try.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2017

Title: Cutest Comfy Ugly Shoe You Can Buy
Review: I bought this classic fit (wide) shoe in size 6 men to get a size 8 women's.  It fits perfectly.  Most comfortable shoe or clog ever.  They are also ugly but they are so ugly that they are cute. To be clear, I bought these to wear with fluffy socks so I have the room I need (my feet are not wide) when wearing the fluffy socks. The strap can be in the back or in the front.  I like having it across my heel when wearing socks.  Feet don't sweat thanks to all of the vents.  You can also put cute little Jibbitz on them that people will notice and take their attention away from the ugly shoes.  You can wear these things all day, 10-12 hours and your feet and legs will hold out.  I got the original classic style because so many people online complained about the soles coming apart on the newer style.  So buyer beware, if you try them you will love them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2017

Title: and we like how easy it is to get them on
Review: I never, ever thought I'd wear Crocs, but here I am.Our 1.5 year old daughter loves her Crocs, and we like how easy it is to get them on, how we don't have to fuss over socks, etc. They're great summer shoes for kids. After a while I started thinking about getting myself a pair just as yard work/grilling/fishing/etc. shoes for the same reason. Which is what they started as, but during one Home Depot trip I realized I never took them off and was wearing them out. Fair game, I guess I'm living the Croc life now.Regarding sizing, I saw some strange advice all over. And perhaps it's different between colors, so for clarity's sake I got the Khaki color. Anyway, I saw some people talking about sizing down, but I really don't think that's the right way to go. Crocs do feel loose on your feet, but just wear them around a bit and you'll realize that they're just fine and very secure. The bottom "floats" a little bit so you don't develop blisters, but the strap holds them to your feet pretty well. If this were a normal shoe, then I'd size down. But it's not, and it doesn't wear/stretch/weigh the same, so I recommend getting your true size. I'm a 12D, sometimes 11.5 or 12.5, and once in a blue moon a 13. Size 12 works fine for me here.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2017

Title: I have avoided crocs because they are big clown shoes in appearance and I didn't want look like a.
Review: These are my first crocs.  I have avoided crocs because they are big clown shoes in appearance and I didn't want look like a ...you know.  I finally bought a pair because I am now swimming regularly and needed shoes that could get wet at the pool.  I hate flip flops, which abrade the tender area between big toe and second toe.  Well, I bought the crocs and they are awesome!  Very comfortable.  I have arthritis in my feet and the crocs are surprisingly supportive.  I wear them for long drives.  They are great at the dog park or in the back yard where I am likely to step in something that is very difficult to clean off sneakers but comes off easily with a hose or a wipe from my clogs.  Best of all, I look cool in them, and I know this because the younger generation is impressed.  Not the 20 somethings, who tend to roll their eyes, or my contemporaries who look askance and ask if I have been gardening but the stylesetters of tomorrow.  I wore them to the beach and a toddler and a four year old both patted my shoes. Now I want crocs in every color of the rainbow.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2015

Title: Never thought I'd buy but very happy now
Review: Never thought I'd buy a pair of crocs. I've been making fun of them for the past decade but when we moved into a new place with hard floors, I needed something to wear around the house. I stand/walk a lot at work and wanted something that was very comfortable.Got these bad boys and couldn't be happier. After a long day in dress shoes I look forward to wearing these when I get home. Great for working around the house and going up and down the stairs on hard flooring. I flip the strap up and go for the clog configuration. The look better that way and stay on fine without the strap behind your heel. Also nice that they are pretty grippy. I wear them cooking in the kitchen and don't have any issues when I spill stuff on the floor.I would definitely recommend these to anyone. They don't look the coolest but I'm a dad now so I'm fine with that. They are a much more comfortable upgrade from flip flop or slipper for wearing around the house. My only regret is not getting a cool color. If you're gonna get crocs you might as well go big!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2017

Title: Comfy but there are size inconsistencies
Review: I ordered 2 pairs of these crocs classics, cerulean and pepper. Pepper is a true red (I was worried it might look pink) and the cerulean is very blue, not purple at all. I usually wear men's size 8.5 shoes and an m8/w10 fit when tried on in a store. However I read lots of reviews that said the sizes were very inconsistent. I need these soon so don't have time to mess with exchanges so I ordered m8/w10 and m9/w11. They were exactly the same size. Width, length, everything was the same, it was weird. I think they fit more like a m9/w11 but that's fine. I wanted/expected these to be pretty loose like my old ones from over a decade ago. These are pretty comfy like I remember and hopefully they last like my old ones did. I didn't find them shiny, uncomfortably small/narrow or the nubs inside to be too painful, which were all common complaints. Overall I say try them on in store first especially if you're in between sizes. I have high hopes for these. (These are the made in mexico ones by the way)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2017

Title: Yay, crocs!
Review: Because of wide feet, I've been afraid of ordering these popular shoes.  Over the years I've had to return or give away shoes I carefully chose, cos only the front of my feet are wide (like a duck). Have to have some sort of strap, or tie on.  My siblings would urge me to try them, so I took the plunge. The 1st pair had to be returned because of a simply mistake at the factory; the wrong size was put in the box.  The replacement arrived yesterday, and I could turn cartwheels, if I could. So comfortable, roomy, and no breaking in period. With regular leather shoes, the little toe on my right foot is still squeezed; with the Crocs, no problem!  And it keeps my feet cool! These are officially my fav shoes. Plan to buy more in diff colors.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2017

Title: OBSESSED.
Review: these just arrived not even 10 minutes ago and i'm already writing a review ! such a cute colour (pink lemonade) and they came brand new with all the original tags. didn't get a fake or damaged pair. also, i was VERY worried about the fit because the reviews were all over the place and i haven't worn crocs since elementary school lol my left foot is also a size smaller than my right, so finding shoes is a struggle to say the least. BUT. these fit PERFECTLY (on both feet !) i've never had a shoe fit so well before. i got a size 6 and believe me when i say i spent DAYS looking through reviews and debating between sizes and i'm glad i didn't size up. they fit very true to size. also, my adidas superstar's are a size US 4.5, sperry's are a size 6, nike air force 1's are size 6.5, and hollister/abercrombie flip flops/sandals are a size small (6-7), etc. only putting these for reference because i know that's one of the things i always look for in reviews. kind of unrelated but useful info in some cases.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020

Title: How Crocs Changed My Life
Review: I will admit, I once was a hater. I lived a hateful negative life where I truly despised this footwear. But recently I've made many drastic life changes and these shoes have helped me see the light. They have helped me to see the beauty of the world and give me the confidence to face whatever obstacles life may throw my way. I can now walk outside with confidence. Crocs truly change your life and bring people together. I will forever be indebted to this spectacular shoe.

Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020

Title: Best Purchase Ever
Review: literally best purchase of my life. Everything went well was packaged very nicely. They looked great with my prom dress. I couldn't have asked for anything else
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2016

Title: My new FAVORITE SHOES 💯😊
Review: I am so GRATEFUL my sis got her Croc’s for work and then I thought to myself those are super comfy looking. Well yes they are comfy and easy to clean. I’m basically wearing them anytime I have to run outside to do gardening or pick up dog poop 💩, I’ve also worn them out running errands as well. I love the bright blue color I got. I had to return the first pair I ordered since they were too large. So I went a size down and they fit perfectly! I couldn’t be happier with this purchase! Oh and I’ve stepped in a massive pile of GSD 💩 and it washes right off these adorable shoes. Perfect function so easy to clean. I’m literally hooked for life and I don’t know how I never bought 🐊 Croc’s before?!?!My order came in the time frame they said it would. It took about a week, with Prime. Worth the wait. I love the fact that they look good with everything I wear. I don’t dress up much so I wouldn’t recommend wearing them with an evening gown 😂 but they are breathable and my feet don’t stink in these either. They were in new packaging too. I will get lots of use out of these for sure. They are super comfortable and actually feel great on my feet. All and all my new favorite house shoes 💯!!! I definitely recommend this purchase to anyone out there who hasn’t tried these out before! They are amazing! Stay safe out there!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020

Title: Comfy and Convenient
Review: My husband wore crocs on our first date and I honestly almost ended it then, but I decided what the heck. Who cares what he wears on his feet?? Then he revealed that he usually wears his crocs with SOCKS. It’s freaking hideous and I have made fun of him for YEARS. But recently, I needed a pair of shoes to toss on to take the dog on quick walks or just run to the mailbox and he surprised me with a pair of these bad boys (in mint, my favorite color). I swore I wouldn’t wear them.. and yet, Here I am! Wearing them every stinkin day now!! These shoes are not stylish. They make your feet look like gigantic doll feet. But they are THE most comfortable and convenient shoes I’ve ever worn. They are easy to clean, breathable and great for days at the beach or river. If my husband sees this, I admit I was wrong. I still won’t say that out loud, but here ya go.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020

Title: Get them on sale! Worth every penny!
Review: I’ve actually always disliked crocks for some reason but something sparked inside my head while in quarantine and decided to give them a chance since I wouldn’t be leaving my house any time soon and no one would see me in them and honestly It was the best decision I’ve ever made!I actually got them on sale $10 off so I only paid $32 bucks and I love them! The insole was a little uncomfortable the first few days of wearing them, they poke and feel wired and itch your feet s bit after you take them off but after wearing them a few days , I don’t even wanna take them off! Lol➡️ Sizing!!! ⬅️I was skeptical about ordering them online because I don’t know my size in there size but after much research and reviews I figured out that crocks are more comfortable and suppose to fit big!I wear a Size 9.5 (men) and have a pretty wide foot and everywhere said to size one up so I got size 10 (men) and they fit perfectly and comfortably!Over all I would recommend a pair for everyone ! Went outside did some grading stuff rinsed them right off looked good as new!! Can’t wait to Customize them! 10/10 recommend!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020

Title: Crocs are my life
Review: Where do I begin. If you do not own a pair of crocs by now, you need to buy yourself a pair right now. I used to buy “crocs” from the 99 cents store because I was on a budget, and by budget I mean absolutely broke. It wasn’t until I got my first job two years ago where I bought my first real pair and mannnn when I tell you that these are the most comfortable shoes ever, these are the most comfortable shoes ever. I can’t believe I was walking around in the knock off ones with no support, no wonder my back hurt so much. Well here I am two years later and I own 18 pairs of crocs. Everybody used to make fun of me but now I have people asking me for croc recommendations. If you are worried about looking dumb because these aren’t the cutest foot wear out there, these shoes are made to help you come as you are. If you are confident, it shines through. I almost have every color in the classic clogs and I am now going to invest in some bayaband, lite ride and bistro clogs. Crocs are an everyday, every moment type of thing for me and I am so glad that I am able to truly express myself through my beautiful crocs.I WILL SAY AS A SIDENOTE, those who experience discomfort, it may be because you have a flat foot as those with flat feet are better of wearing shoes like vans, converse, etc. (shoes that have no arch support)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020

Title: Works great on my feet!
Review: My chiropractor recommended wearing crocs since I started having plantar fasciitis problems. I usually wear woman's size 8 shoes, and got these in size 8. They seem a little big but it's actually more comfortable to wear that way, so I think these fit me perfectly. I like to life up the back holder part and wear them around like sandals. It's also nice when it's cold cause I can just slip them on with my socks on. As for dealing with my plantar fasciitis, it ended up working for me! I wore these every day, and at first I didn't notice that much of a difference and my feet ached in the morning for a while too, but around a year into wearing these, I have completely recovered from plantar fasciitis!! It's like I never even had plantar fasciitis before! I think it took a while for my feet to heal since it's something we use every day. Now I am able to wear normal flat sandals too and my feet are fine in the mornings. I still wear crocs and their brand sandals for my main footwear though, cause I think it helps to prevent plantar fasciitis from happening.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019

Title: Husband Hates the Look, LOVES the feel
Review: My husband has Plantar fasciitis (as I also have) and he has tried different inserts, balls to rub his feet on, exercises, etc.I have been wearing Crocs for over a year and they have alleviated my pain significantly, but he didn't like the way they looked.So, I decided to buy him a pair for Christmas, told him to just wear them around the house. He LOVES them. His feet are so much better, he takes his work shoes off the minute he gets in the house to put these on. I am so glad I bought them for him! He has actually talked to a couple of friends at work who told him they have been wearing them for years for the same reason!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018

Title: BABYYYYY My feet are in Heaven
Review: So full disclosure in this review so please don't judge. There aren't any Crocs stores in the area I live in but I heard they were really comfortable and good support for people who are on their feet all day. I have issues with my arches and typically wear arch supports in my shoes so that I can both walk better and so my feet don't hurt. When I don't wear my arch supports, my feet hurt and the pain radiates up to my knees and higher. I love to wear flip flops but if you are like me, your doctor told you heck no that's horrible for your feet.So, I purchased a bunch of "garden" shoes or fake crocs. Don't get me wrong these are amazing and I wear them all the time I just had no idea that they weren't real crocs. Let me try to explain.I saw the yellow colored crocs in DSW about 3 weeks ago and fell in love, but of course they didn't have any more even online in my size in yellow. I come to trusty old AMAZON and they are selling for more than $40. No thank you I will wait. I check out the CROCS site and with shipping its more than that. So I wait. I wait and wait until they drop down to $31 and change and I get em. Now you guys don't know me but I am just excited to add another color to my collection so I thought.I sprayed them down with Lysol after I open the zip lock bag they were in and sat them on my back porch you know for safety and all that good stuff. So I take the trash out and remember that they are out there so I bring em in and wash em off again because now they have outside germs even though no one has been on or near my back porch. I dry them off and put them on my feet.HALLELUJAH!!!!I thought I had ascended to heaven! You don't know the struggles I have with these here size 8's. The support I felt, the cushion I felt, the prinkly things in the shoe that massage my feet while feeling slightly weird when my toes touch them when I am sitting, it all was surreal. I woke up my brother. I went outside and screamed YES YES YES like I was a WWE wrestler. I immediately came back to amazon to look and see what color shoe I didn't have to order more.Needless to say, I look at price too and I can't afford any of these colors at this time but I LOVE MY YELLOW CROCS. I prefer crocs over sneakers or tennis but I wear tennis to protect my foot in case I feel like jogging or running.Buy you these shoes. Don't have any yet? Ain't nothing like the real thing is all I have to say.TRUST ME ON THIS ONE!Signed,A Satisfied customer
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020

Title: Whaaatt are thooossseee?!
Review: Ordered a W8. This is my first pair of Crocs & I’m not sure whyyyyyy I waited this long to get a pair. Now I see why ppl use it. Very comfortable. I’m flat footed. I was able to wear it barefoot & also w| thin socks (tester around the house). The strap part to keep your feet in, it’s actually shorter than the actual length of the shoe (it’s not lined up with the heel part . Around a quarter of an inch or so from the heel) so when it goes around the back of your foot, it actually pushes your feel more inside the shoe. This isn’t a big deal for me as I’m actually a 7.5 women’s. I always love ordering any shoe item a half size bigger to have the extra room for thicker socks if needed. My Crocs were made in Mexico. I’ve seen some complaints about sizing issues when it’s made in different countries. Anyways, I would recommend a pair to anyone.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2019

Title: Great versatile play shoes
Review: We love crocs- all of my kids have a pair as their summer play shoes! We have a small farm and these are perfect- they can step in anything and hose off without a problem, wear them to play in the creek or the pond (if they come off in the pond they float and are easily retrievable!), and the versatility of wear with the heel strap makes it great for super active kids that like to run. I purchased this pair for my oldest, and as usual they are slightly bigger but we expected that. Great product.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020

Title: The advice is to go a size down, but I suggest going a size up!
Review: I love these shoes! Crocs are silly looking yes, but that is what I love about them! I'm writing this review mainly just to note that in the description, it advises that if you're a half size to go a size down, since crocs can be large fitting/wide. However, this wasn't the case for me. I'm a size 7 and 1/2 in womens, so I chose a size 7, but I had to return it as I found it too tight fitting. If you fit size 8 converse just fine, then you most likely have feet similar to mine, so I'd recommend going a size up! Even without socks, it was uncomfortable enough for me to have to return it for a larger size.Besides the size issue, the shoes are wonderful! The coupon is also a great deal.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2019

Title: Some things seem off .
Review: I ordered the yellow (beautiful , bright color by the way) ! The shoe itself fits PERFECTLY!! I ordered my regular size and the fit is right on. My only concern is (after reading previous reviews about counterfeit shoes) after comparing them to my other CROCS (whom I know for a fact are authentic) , things does seem a little off. I’m not sure if it means anything . But my other crocs read “Made in Vietnam” and these read “Made in China” ... which has me a little confused. Again , IT MAY BE NOTHING !! I just had to point out that fact . Which that may be why these looks a little cheaper than my originals . They look kinda like they were RUSHED on the assembly line when you’re looking at them closely  . Other than this . They’re great ! Great color , size , fit . I’m definitely gonna keep them !
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2020

Title: Caved and bought a pair. After this review, you will to
Review: Anyone going on deployment needs Crocs, so I got these for $30ish. They came in a plastic Crocs bag in new condition. I put them on and immediately felt weird, but you eventually get over your loss of dignity, as everyone else owns a pair. When they’re new, they have these nubs that you put your feet onto that stab you with every step, but in a good way. Every other shoe brand says I’m a 9M, but Crocs think I’m a 10M, so make sure you get a size up for anything from this brand. There is no slip resistance, so watch yourself in the shower. The Off-road ankle strap seems durable and the whole shoe feels like it will hold up to any challenge. The top is flexible and will stretch.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020

Title: Perfect! Order up a size; especially if you wear a half size!
Review: *I bought the charms separately on amazon; highly recommend(never too old for charms!!)**I normally wear a size women’s 9 (sometimes 9.5) but I bought a size 10. I ALWAYS recommend going up a size in crocs. These are not sneakers that need to be snug. You don’t want these to be tight at all! These are relaxing shoes. If they are snug, your feet will rub, get smelly, and create sores from the rubbing. And my foot just barely hangs over the edge when I bought a size 9 a while ago.They have a strap on the back to help keep your feet in place (I call that putting them in 4 wheel drive), or you can flip the strap to the front (shown in my picture). I prefer it that way because it’s easy to slide on and off like slippers.I personally wear this pair to work.I bought different colors for day to day wear.They are SUPER easy to clean! I typically use a disinfectant wipe; but you can use all purpose cleaner a towel, spray Lysol, wash them in the sink with dish soap, etc. But do NOT use bleach!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020

Title: Surprisingly Great
Review: I didn’t want to love Crocs. They are so boxy and ugly, but that ugliness grew on me really fast once I started wearing them. I bought them because I needed gardening shoes. My other shoes were constantly having soil and other yard debris packed into the treads and it was way too much work to clean them out. So, I decided to give a pair of Crocs a try since with the holes they should get decent airflow and I could hose them off or toss them in the washing machine as needed. So, I reluctantly bought a pair of very purple Crocs.After a week of wearing my new Crocs, I can say I totally get why people love these things.They have NO arch support, which for me is generally horrible but they’re so roomy that it’s more like walking barefoot than it is like wearing bad shoes.With as roomy as they are, not at all form fitting, you’d think your feet would slip and slide all over the place and you’d have to work to keep them on your feet. But they don’t. My feet stay in place and the Crocs stay on my feet just fine.Nothing sticks to them. Dirt and soil get in through the holes, but also go right back out through the holes, just leaving behind dirty feet. And nothing has stuck to the treads: dirt, soil, mud, dog poop, compost… nothin’. They also don’t stay wet long at all. I had to go out in the pouring rain and they were dry by the time I walked through my house.And, with all the holes, there’s great air circulation, just about as good as sandals. This was my first pair of Crocs; I doubt it will be my last. They’re too comfortable and convenient not to love them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020

Title: Great, love them.
Review: This is the second pair of Crocs I bought in the last month. Never owned a pair and always thought they looked ugly, and never understood why there was this attraction to them.I have wide feet, 12 4E, I was skeptical the 12 M size was going to be too tight.  They fit perfectly, I guess because they are wide to start off with, although if I had narrow feet I probably wouldn't be too happy with them.The things are super comfortable and around the house, I wear them with strap up front so I can just slip them off and on like a pair of slippers.  When I go out I wear the strap in the rear to secure them completely on my feet.They may not be the most beautiful pair of footwear, but I have worn them out dancing, even playing golf. They're great, that's why I bought this second pair.I was also skeptical about the little knobs on the inside of the shoe, but these I found kind of massage your feet and make them feel good.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2019

Title: Raised letters that say Hecho in Mexico on strap hurt the backs of my feet, this is new
Review: I have been wearing crocs for years. I have had many pairs of this kind that I ordered. However, this time I bought them, I put them on, and wore them for a few hours. And I was like why are the backs of my ankles hurting? It felt like something was rubbing the backs of my ankles. I tried to ignore it, but ultimately I became worried it was going to rub the skin off my ankles so I took the shoes off and looked at them. The reason why the strap hurts is because it says "Hecho in Mexico" in RAISED lettering!! The letters on the inside of the strap are raised and keep rubbing the backs of my ankles as I walk. So I have concluded that the only way to wear these shoes safely is to move the strap from the back ankle area to the top of the shoe, which I don't like. Why did you have to do this, Crocs??? Please stop putting the raised letters of Hecho in Mexico on the inside strap because it hurts my skin. I want Crocs to stop making the shoes like this, because it sucks if my shoes hurt because of this. Why?? Please remove this lettering off the inside straps because you're causing pain to your customers.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020

Title: 13 year journey from 2007 to 2020 achievement unlocked
Review: In 2007 I really wanted a pair of crocs but we couldn’t afford the name brand so I got purple air walks instead. Most of my life has been that Clover Valley or Great Value edition. Flash forward to 2020, I bought my first pair of crocs in my mid twenties. I’ve been preparing 13 years to experience this moment. Do I have regrets for purchasing hole shoes? Probably. Do I have an insane amount of air flow for my toes? Most definitely. Am I posting a ridiculous photo review on Amazon about my journey? You bet. I was not prepared for the true power unlocked through wearing crocs.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020

Title: MOST COMFORTABLE SHOES EVER!♥️🤞🏻
Review: I got these for my husband, he is a size 10 to size 11 in men's shoes, and I bought a size 10 and it fit perfectly.From my experience these shoes always have an extra wiggle room in the back so if you're in between sizes going down one won't hurt.Also, it is the authentic Crocs brand and is great quality. It's light to walk with, not heavy to the foot! 👞♥️
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020

Title: Perfect for Disney!
Review: Love these crocs!!  Family planned a vacation to Disney and we heard that to avoid blisters we should purchase a pair of crocs.  Needless to say, they saved our vacation.  I wore nothing but the cros while we were there.  I didn't want to take the chance of getting blisters walking 25,000 steps a day for 10 days.  They are quick and easy to dry after getting wet, can be worn with or without short socks, are very comfortable to walk in, cushioned and arch support.  Toe width has enough room for comfortable spread with no rubbing on sides or top of toes.  I wouldn't recommend any other shoe for Disney or for sore tired feet.  Just love them!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019

Title: Not the nicest looking shoe but the most comfy.
Review: As much as I'd love brown leather wingtip oxfords, they're impossible to find in womens size 5/6 in Wide Width. or anything nice looking for that matter. and I got tired of looking. When you have Cerebral Palsy, dressing is a struggle. I got to a point where I wanted something that I could put on without help, and comfortable with or without socks. Are they kinda ugly? Yeah. But it's worth it. I plan on getting two in black so they can blend in with my pants, but sometimes I enjoy colors. So far I own a Slate Grey and Navy. Both pairs were the right size (I ended up getting Womens 6. A little roomy but not too much, and i have tiny feet) Obviously they're snugger when I wear them with fuzzy socks.  These shoes are also great toe box wise. My heel is very narrow and my foot widens up to my toe box. The toe box is wide enough to where I don't feel squeezed at all, even with thick socks.When I'm travelling and the hotel doesn't have a shower seat I can wear these in the shower since I can't go barefoot. They are very easy to rinse out and dry.Even with my issue with dragging my left big toe, they're pretty sturdy. Most shoes after half a year would already have a hole and need to be replaced. I plan on getting second pairs just to have just in case, but I don't think my left shoes will wear through soon. They're not extremely supportive, I wouldn't recommend them for running, but as someone with chronic pain and weak ankle/foot muscles, these are great for around the house and walking through a bookstore.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2019

Title: Decent support for around the house
Review: I got these on a friend's recommendation after avoiding Crocs for years. I never understood what the hype was before, but my friend insisted that if I wanted something to support my feet while doing things around the house, these would be a good choice. I am glad I gave them a chance, and am now debating on getting a second pair for wearing out.While the arch support isn't spectacular, it's a massive step up from trying to shove insoles into slippers like I was doing before. They hold their shape well so far, they fit comfortably, have a little bit of shock absorption to them, and best of all they are EASY TO CLEAN! Also if you're a bit clumsy like me, the roomy toe area makes a great buffer to prevent you from injuring yourself by stubbing your toes.They fit very well without being too tight, and stay on my feet with or without the heel strap, so I've taken to keeping the strap folded up over the front to get in and out of them more easily.I'm definitely a fan now that I've tried them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020

Title: Perfect for everyday wear!
Review: As strange as crocs look, they sure are comfortable. I wear these bad boys every single day. If I know I’ll be walking a lot, I’ll pull the heel strap back and kick them into 4WD. 100% worth buying.On a serious note, I love my crocs. Perfect for every day wear, and even better to wear at the beach. The holes around the toes allow a lot of ventilation, and easy to shake out the sand.They’re lightweight and extremely easy to clean. They are also able to withstand different environments, whether you’re walking on sharp surfaces such as rocks or glass. I’ve also tested them on slippery surfaces, surprisingly haven’t fallen yet!I get a lot of compliments on my crocs, especially when I’m wearing my scrubs. The color hasn’t faded, and I’ve put them through a lot since I got them. If you’re debating whether or not you should take a chance on these bad boys, here’s your sign saying you should.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020

Title: Order a size down if you like a normal non-loose fit...
Review: Overall, I've been very happy with my Classic Crocs.  I wear a size 7.5 shoe and I own several pairs of Croc Flip-Flops/Sandals which I ordered in a size 8 (happy I did for those).  However, many have said the Classic Clogs run large.  After sizing my foot according to the chart it still said for me to order a size 8.  I went against that and ordered a size 7 based on the reviews saying they run large.  I'm so glad I ordered down a size! They fit how my normal shoe would because I do not like any loose feeling when I'm walking.  Even with my socks on they fit great and are surprisingly comfortable.  I can walk long distances without any foot fatigue.  Only minor negative I would say is my feet get warm in them.  I don't notice it until I sit down when having them on.  Other than that I'll definitely be purchasing additional pairs and love how easy they are to clean!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020

Title: Heavenly Feel. Massages the soles of my feet and keeps them from itching.
Review: My first pair of Crocs just arrived and after wearing them one day, I am in love!I got these shoes because my feet itch in other shoes during the summer time. The cloth interior  of regular shoes trap sweat and bacteria. It  is just not sanitary.I can wash, wipe and sanitize the inside of my Crocs every day if I want in order to avoid that issue.I intend to wear these barefoot, outside, after the shower and anytime I want because I can still keep them sanitary.Now, for the feel: Ooh, la la! I love the textured insides. The little raised bumps and spikes inside the shoes poke the bottom of my feet, giving them a massage and relieving tension when I walk. This feels so good!Often my feet are tired and stressed and I have to press them against something or do exercises to relieve them. But now, Crocs can destress my feet for me while I walk.Also, I like that I can wear the straps over the top of my feet like a slide-in slipper or behind my heel . It's so convenient to have two types of styles.  When I put the straps behind my heel, I can feel the spikes inside the shoes better so that is my preferred style after a long day.These shoes are very roomy. At first I thought they were too wide, but I like that there's so much room.The only concern was that one strap is a little looser than the other. Since most factories have standardization, I questioned whether I was sent a knock-off or the real thing. I hope these are real. Either way, they feel super good and I intend to get several pair.Now, let me get off the internet and go walk in my Crocs because my feet want to play!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020

Title: Roomy Fit
Review: It doesn't say so on the description here but these crocs are labeled as 'Roomy Fit' so they are huge.  It's a little weird but it seems like Crocs fit differently depending on where they are made. I'm a 7.5 and initially opted for a 5/7 but found that it was too tight for my toes when I put the strap on the back of my heel. This was on a pair made in Mexico. However I have a 5/7 that was made in Vietnam that fit fine with or without the strap. So for this one I decided to order a size up to make sure that it will be comfortable no matter where it was made. The pair I received was made in Vietnam but since they are 'Roomy Fit' they are way too big. The color is gorgeous so I'm going to return these and order my regular size again and hope for the best.Update:I received the 5/7 today and they’re perfect! Leaving the review at 4 stars because it really should be in the description that these are roomy fit.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2020

Title: My go-to comfy shoes
Review: Crocs were born in my hometown, well the town I lived in the longest, I should say. At first, I thought they looked hideous, kinda still do, to be honest. They make people's feet look huge. Yet, when I tried a pair at my daughter's house, because she insisted it was like walking on clouds, and I had a very sore, broken foot, I couldn't believe how comfortable they were. I began to sing a new tune! I became all about comfortable shoes. And this ics coming from a woman who's family owned several chains of shoes stores for 77 years! High-end fashion shoes, mid-range casual boots and shoes, and lower end shoes too. We never had anything like these in our stores though (they hadn't been invented yet). We did sell Jellies (remember those?) in the summer in the low-priced shops, but Crocs are so much nicer.I have owned and worn out 5 pairs of the classic Crocs in various colors, as well as 2 pairs of the winter lined ones. I just bought more classics, in more colors, because why not wear comfy shoes? I wear them gardening and when I'm being super casual. I keep a couple pairs as indoor slippers too. Will have to order a new pair for winter soon.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020

Title: Good Buy!
Review: A little about me so you can categorize my review:  I live in Hawaii where Crocs and Bermuda shorts are de rigueur.  I wear dress shoes at weddings and restaurants, but I have seen people wear them there without being asked to leave.I go through about 2 pairs a year (yes, Hawaii, ha ha).I actually expected to buy a pair at our local slipper shop where I normally get them, but I was shocked to find they had gone to $45/pair!  I whipped out my phone & showed the lady they are $26 on Amazon.  She smiled and said she would help me find a good fit so I could order from Amazon (Hawaii has pretty girls with pretty manners).I was apprehensive because of other reviews, but my pair fit as well as any, and the rubber seemed about average.  The toe box and width were a little more generous and the arch support was a little flatter, but overall, fit is as expected.  The tread on the new Crocs is more robust.  That is a plus for Hawaii because it rains everyday here, and slippery footwear are dangerous, especially on steps, sidewalks, and roads without dedicated walking paths.  My previous pairs were made in Mexico; these were made in China.  (Maybe these were made more with Haole feet in mind.)  The pic shows my existing (Mexico) Croc on the left, and the new (China) Croc on the right.Good: price, fit, wear, appearanceBad: (none)Summary: II like them. I am going to order another pair for our other house.-Larry
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2020

Title: WOW
Review: For the last 4 years my feet have been blistered, over callused and in severe pain by the end of my shifts! This was to the point that I almost decided NOTHING would help and that after 40 years on my feet in the restaurant industry, I was destined  to a future of crippling pain. Everyone was telling me that Crocs were that answer but, I was thinking how could a shoe for such a little price help my feet? After all I had spent hundreds on different shoes throughout the last four years... Finally I caved and figured at the price, I could just throw them away like the rest of the EXPENSIVE shoes I had purchased. Let me tell you what a glorious feeling right from the start!!! My feet and back no longer hurt even after 8 - 10 hour shifts! They feel like wearing nothing at all, so naturel and comfy! Do your self a favor and try Crocs!!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019

Title: We love crocs
Review: My husband and I love crocs and have used them for years. I had terrible pain in the heel of my foot and crocs has completely cured it. Fit true to size in my experience. Colors pictured are navy, pepper, neon magenta, camo, purple, khaki
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2017

Title: Awesome
Review: These guys are amazing.  For years, I avoided them despite of the hype some time ago.  The funny thing is that I was always looking for a shoe that can work as a slipper because that would be so practical for traveling.The regular clogs don’t have enough backing on the heel to be a shoe.  I got these slippers once and tried to use them as shoes but they have no soles and so very uncomfortable to walk on hard surfaces and got really wet when it was raining.  The soft shoes have too much backing on the heel and so cannot be used as a slipper.Enter the Croc’s innovative design that has a movable heel strap so it’s a slipper when you’re at home and a shoe when you’re moving around.In the picture, they look solid so you know they will work on hard surfaces.  My concern was if they are comfortable because it looks like hard plastic but it is really some rubber or silicone material so quite soft and comfy.The only thing is the sizing is off.  I wear 9.5 and got a 10 but I should have gotten a 9.  It is loose but not really an issue except if you plan to drive wearing them.  I have a manual car and I stalled the car when I drove it wearing these for first time.I don’t think looks is a problem and very subjective.  In this case, they become so iconically ugly that many ppl think they’re beautiful now.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2018

Title: Yes.
Review: I'm a pretty average looking dude, but now that I have these Crocs™ I am easily the sexiest person I know.Seriously though --  they are convenient, they are comfortable, and they are awesome.  My wife hates them, but I just can't give them up.  They are the fanny pack of shoes: crazy convenient, but everybody makes fun of them for some reason.  Don't care.  I'm a middle-aged fat guy with three kids.  I don't have to care about that stuff any more and that's freaking rad.  Wear these Crocs™ and be awesome like me.[I know the product description says "Women's Crocs" but they are being worn by a dude just fine. No idea what that's all about.]
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020

Title: Never bought Crocs  befroe they are worth the money
Review: Was looking for a new pair of Crocs to replace my older pair and after going to the outlet store and finding nothing i decided to just order them from amazon found the style i liked and a color and they had them in my size ordered them i have had other pairs of Crocs in the past and knew what i was getting so didn't think twice about not getting them after the first week of getting a new pair of Crocs and telling myself im going to keep them i take and remove the straps and side buttons to get them to fit the way i like them and they are mostly my house shoes and as of lately i take them to work and switch out of my work shoes and into them for the drive home overall they are comfortable to wear the colors pop and they are true to size and you dont have to go up a size which is what i do when i am looking for regular shoes but not with Crocs they fit right and i love the feel
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2020

Title: OMG, I am now a total Crocs Convert !!!
Review: A friend bought me a pair, and I was HOOKED.  So I ordered this pair via Amazon in the Ice Blue color, in my normal sneaker-size women's US 7.  They fit true to size.  I'm so glad I discovered Crocs...  They are so comfy, light & airy, with great cushioning for walking all day long.  I used to think they were just plastic gardening shoes, or just comfy clogs for nurses & doctors.  But NOW I am seeing Crocs everywhere.... They have become a highly sought-after fashion item!  I also ordered the medium pink color (via Amazon), so now I have 3 pair of Crocs.  The bright fun colors make me smile, they are actually "in fashion" right now, and my feet couldn't be happier.PS... I advise to google them & check out the prices from various department stores, shoes stores, etc, & compare those prices with Amazon's pricing.  Although I must say this seller shipped pretty fast, had a competitive price, AND has the largest assortment of colors to choose from!  Great purchase.  -- Thank you :)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2020

Title: Needs a little break in time to get a great fit!
Review: Ok, so I never thought I would wear Crocs but after years and years of hype through movies, online, word of mouth, internet, and personal friends, I figure I'd try them.  And they were all correct! These really are great feeling things for my feet.  They aren't cool looking (at least not for an American non-hipster male) but boy are the nice feeling and functional. Specifically on function, I was looking for a camp slipper that I could slip on around the campsite/RV/Campground/lodge/cabin and walk outside without putting on boots or sneakers.  Sandals are ok if you're a boy or when on an island beach but anywhere else, nope.  Moccasins are ok, but typically they do not have a hard sole.  So camp slippers with hard soles are becoming a thing but they are typically over $80 and at that point they are just a really cheap boot.  So Crocs help fill the void and niche for a camp slipper.  Of course, Crocs are not insulated but inside I usually have socks on so these are perfect, esp in non cold months or climates because with socks or no socks I can slip the feet right into these things. And so far, without socks these things do not make the feet hot (at least not mine) so not a lot of foot sweat and the resulting stink.  What I have learned is that these things do stretch, at least a little which is good.  I ordered a size 9 ( i wear a 9.5 in boots/drewss shoes [Danner, Allen Edmonds, Sperry) and tennis shoes are a 10 [Nike, Adddis, Chucks]) and when they first arrived, the left one fit perfectly but the right one seemed a tad small since a couple of my toes were just barely bumping up against the front of the croc.  Plus I kinda thought my heals were right on the back edge of the croc but despite this , they were still pretty comfy but not great. Plus,the first few days of ownership and wearing without socks, the tops and sides of my feet were getting a few hot spots from rubbing. But nonetheless,  I continued to wear them and powered through hoping they would get better and rather quickly (within a couple weeks) with casual wearing these feel better (my right toes no longer barely touches the front and no hot spots) but I still feel like my heels are on the back edges of the crocks so I think they maybe too short.  But I really like that they fit snug and never feel like a flip-flop that could slide right off my feet, even when barefoot in them. Plus the nubs have a great massaging effect - super sensitive feet may not like it but the nubs are soft and with socks i can't feel them. But because of how good these feel, I want to believe the size 10 will feel better and as a result I have a size 10 on the way.If you can find these in the store, I would try on several pairs of the same size just to see if they fit slightly different due to variances in the QA/QC.  I think a person would be able to find the perfect fit in the store, esp. if they are between sizes like I am.  if my size 9 were just a tad larger they would be perfect.  As it is, I'm expecting the size 10 to be a little too big and slip around but I'm hoping they will work and not slide around but I expect them to feel just a little bit better, otherwise I'll stick to the smaller size due to a potentially better fit.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020

Title: ugly as all get out, but so comfortable you just don't care
Review: I know, I know... they are the "Given up on life" shoe.  They are ugly as sin.  I know this.  But I also know that when I am in hour 16 of standing for the work I do, they are a lifesaver and I'm not thinking about my feet hurting.  I'm thinking about how much I doubt my career choice at that moment, but my feet are fine.  I'm thinking about crying as the sun is coming up and I still have another two or three hours to go, but my feet are good to go. And when I finally crawl into bed, every part of me is calling me names, but my feet are still my friend.Still not as bad as wearing slippers to the grocery store....
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2018

Title: Better Than My Old Ones, But....
Review: These are the genuine Crocs clogs, and are better than my old ones, which I purchased at a famous discount store chain. (Take a look at my photos.  Depending on what device you are using, the photos will show up in a different order.  I have two photos of the Crocs by themselves; one shows the excellent tread on the sole, and the other shows the bumps/points inside.  Two photos show the Crocs side-by-side with my old worn-out store brand clogs.)  But the Crocs are not an entirely unmixed blessing!  First, the Crocs cost over 3x the price of the chain store clogs.  Winner: chain store clogs.  Second, the Crocs are made in Vietnam,  while the chain store ones are made in USA. BIG win for the chain store clogs!  But the Crocs have advantages, too.  First, the Crocs fit as advertised. If you wear a size 11, order a size 11. (These do not come in Wide width. If you need a wider width, consider ordering the next 1/2 size up.  For instance, I wear a men's 10-1/2 Wide in a regular shoe. I ordered these Crocs in men's size 11, and they fit perfectly.)  The chain store clogs run small, so I had to get a size 12 of them. Winner: Crocs. Second, the Crocs sole has better tread and therefore better traction.  (See photos.)  Winner: Crocs. Third, the Crocs come with a strap that you can put around your heel to keep them from slipping off (see photos again).  If you don't want to use the straps, simply fold them up over the front, out of the way.  Winner: Crocs.  Fourth, Crocs have little buttons (or points) molded into the insole that massage the soles of your feet. This may or may not be an advantage, depending on your preference. Hint: if the points bother you, try wearing socks, or thicker socks if you're already using socks. For me, the points only took about 20 minutes of walking to get used to.  NO clear winner here; which is best depends upon your preference.  The Crocs appear well made, fit well, and are very comfortable. The next question for me is, will they outlast my chain store clogs long enough to justify spending more than three times as much money, for a foreign-made product?  The main reasons I bought these are: 1.  I could not get clogs in black anymore from the chain store.  They only come in an ugly brownish-green color that is patterned to look like dead leaves! (If you are a gardener who wants your shoes to blend in with your mulch, you might prefer the chain store clogs. Me, not so much!);  and 2.  I have always wanted to try the genuine Crocs product.  Time will tell whether they were worth the extra investment.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020

Title: If you aint CROCIN', then you aint ROCKIN'!!!
Review: Alright guys, I'll admit it....I've been out of the Croc game for a good while, now. I needed some comfy shoes to wear around the house and to the lake for boating/other activities where i could get my shoes wet and not sweat it. I used to wear these bad boys in high school non-stop (yep, you guessed it...graduated a virgin, but things took a turn for the better quickly after - MOVING ON! lol). Amazon was the only place that carried a 14 like my gargantuan feet need....so i copped em up on wardrobe, just because i was skeptical about falling back in to my old ways. Oh you best believe, the second i put them on i ripped up that return label! Who could deny their ugly, all-day comfort and goodness?!?! Long story, short....haven't stopped wearing them since. They gone from "around the house and on the boat only" shoes to "fine dining, church, barbeque, errands, anywhere that would make my wife embarrassed to be with me, etc." shoes. Currently, fearful that my wife is packing her bags....may be single and alone real soon, idk....but at least i'll be comfortable in my solitude, right?! 10/10 would recommend.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2020

Title: Lemon Yellow Crocs.... Now I own 3 pairs in 3 fabulous colors!
Review: I started with the electric pink color, then the ice blue, then a lighter pink, and now these sunny-cute Lemon Yellow ones.  I never thought I'd like Crocs, but OMG they are so comfy & so cute... I have officially fallen in love with Crocs!  I wear a women's size 7 in sneakers, so that's the size I buy in Crocs, and they fit me perfectly.  I have looked at the Crocs in the shoe stores, and these Crocs from Amazon are indeed the real deal -- and the price is the same on Amazon (sometimes even lower).... plus Amazon usually has a much better selection in available colors, too.  ------  I live in S Florida where it's almost always hot and humid, so my feet love the air conditioned holes in these shoes.  I have loads of sneakers, dressy shoes, and flip flops. But some days you just wanna wear something totally cute & colorful, and comfy.  -----  Btw...  I've noticed that Crocs have become VERY fashionable & "on trend" lately.  I see teenage girls & grown women rockin' them in all sorts of colors.  I'm really enjoying them, and so are my grateful feet.  I can wear them 24/7 and be so comfortable.  I've gotten so many compliments on the Lemon Yellow ones already, and that's from teens to women in their 30's, 40's, 50's and up!  Apparently everyone wants to own a cute pair of colorful Crocs these days.  --- This vendor mailed mine in a hurry & they arrived fast.  I definitely recommend Crocs, and this vendor on Amazon!  And PS... Fashionable guys are rockin' Crocs too these days, and in all the colors !  It's apparently the new big thing. :)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020

Title: Great Shoe
Review: I’m a size 7.5. The 8 is too big. The 7 had to be broken in for 2 weeks, because it was definitely a bit small at first and the outer edge almost touched the back of my foot.But here’s the thing about Crocs. If you get them too big, the arch support won’t work. Your foot isn’t supposed to swim in these. It’s definitely up to the user to decide their fit preference.As for my opinion: If you want a bigger fit, go a size (or in my case, a half-size) up.If you want a more “custom” fit, order true to size (or in my case, a half-size down) and break them in. The rubber loosens up a bit and conforms to your foot.I do think that this model of Crocs has gotten progressively smaller in fit over the past 4 years. So the Crocs of old are a darn sight bigger than today’s sizes.I have wide, duck feet, and the normal width was fine for me.The interior rubber “spikes” inside have also gotten stronger and more effective. So much that it did take me a few weeks to break them in, because the spikes were QUITE spikey for my taste. It calms down after some wear.My husband couldn’t handle the spikes because he has soft feet with zero callus (lucky duck). So if you have sensitive feet, these might need to be worn with some socks until things soften up.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020

Title: Product Is REAL deal...
Review: I needed a new pair of Croc's and when I read the reviews (one star) some people thought that these might be knock off's...fake imitations..and I was a little concerned. But mine arrived today. They are exactly the same as the pair I have (minus the paint spills).. Like exactly. There was concern about these not being as soft as the "Original Brand.".. but what I can tell you is...they are the real deal..they are soft like my old pair. So, for what it is worth I am glad I bought them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2020

Title: Perfect fit with plenty of width!
Review: I’ve waited years to finally spend money on foam shoes. Now that I did, I don’t know that I’ll ever be without a pair again! I checked the fit style on Crocs website before I bought- they have fit descriptions in each style of shoe which described the general feel and how “roomy” or relaxed they are.These are the most roomy shoes they offer. I typically wear a 10.5 men’s, but usually need a wide size. I ordered the 10 size and these are a very comfortable fit. Plenty of room, without feeling too loose or like they’re going to fall off my feet.I wear these around the house for added support, and will wear them out fishing when the weather gets warmer.Tip: I have worn them with some thin socks and I find that keeps my meet foot bottom from getting sweaty in them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020

Title: YES!
Review:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   Ok ok, I know what you are all thinking... "CROCS ARE SO UGLY THEY LOOK LIKE CLOWN SHOES!" It is no secret that for years crocs have been violated for being big and a but um, unique to say the least but these shoes are super super comfortable! Staying home I realized my chanclas were not making the cut and decided to shop for new stay at home footwear, leading me to buying crocs. The ones in the video are ice blue, they are beautiful and comfortable! As someone with arched feet, you will not go wrong with purchasing these. After wearing them relentlessly for weeks it was super noticeable just how unsupportive other brands are with feet arches. Crocs though, they've got your back. They are of a rubbery plastic, so your feet will sweat at first, but after a while, at least for me, they'll stopped sweating. Overall this was worth the purchase since they serve as stay at home, out door and water shoes. They are true to size, however, you may consider sizing up if you want them to be roomy. Overall they're good. (as a size reference I used my Nike slides), I hope this helps!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020

Title: So Light and Comfortable!
Review: I made fun of my husband for wearing them but then I tried his and they seemed comfortable. Low and behold I got mine and these are glorious. I don't care if people think they are silly. I'm rocking them out because they work for what I need. These are like slippers but much lighter. I can slip them right on super easily. I can wear them with or without socks. When I want to go out to the shed outside or to the mailbox I just throw these on. If it's rainy outside, no prob! They stay on really well but if I need a little extra security I just simply throw the strap to the back around my heel and put them in what my husband refers to as four-wheel drive. Definitely recommend these but not if you're lame.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020

Title: They are smaller than my old ones of the same size
Review: I love the ones I bought several years ago. The problem is, the old ones are a very comfortable fit and say 45 on the bottom. The new ones say men's 11 which is supposed to equate to the European 45-46 so I assumed that they would be the same. they are visibly smaller and fit tighter. I may return them and get a men's 12. When I saw the Men's 11, I had reservations but figured the European number stamped into the shoe would be  a better gauge of size. Not so.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2018

Title: Ugliest Shoes Ever, But...
Review: When I first saw someone wearing a pair of Crocs, I remember thinking, “I would not be caught dead in shoes that ugly.”  However, after borrowing a pair to walk home from the beach (my fabric river shoes are impossible to wear if they get sand in them), I was sold.  I have bunions the size of walnuts on both feet - plus the sores from the fabric shoes - and was able to walk the mile home from the beach in the Crocs with no trouble.  The pair I borrowed were a boy’s  Junior 5 and they fit like the Women’s size 7.  I will not make fun of Crocs ever again.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020

Title: I wear an women's 8 or 8.5, Purchased size 9
Review: Really great for the tropical areas of Hawaii.  Constantly getting these wet/ full of mud and rinsing them.  Also good for Hawaii because everyone takes their shoes of to go indoors - they slip on easily.  Not super comfortable, as people often say of Crocs, and not very supportive at all.  I might think of buying these again to wear in Chicago, because of ease of use, but not sure.  If you wear an 8 or 8.5, I'd definitely suggest following other reviewer's recommendations, and sizing up.  A 9 worked perfectly for me, but at first even the 9 felt a tiny bit short.  I think they do stretch, but like I said, I wore them constantly in wet weather, which I believe helps with the stretch.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2019

Title: Great deal on an extremely practical piece of ugly footwear!
Review: Rare to find this brand at the Amazon price I paid - wanted a clog with heel strap so I could safely drive back & forth to the local aquatic center.  I wasn't excited about the glossy black appearance, but since I only wear them to drive from my garage to the pool, walk about 200 feet across hot concrete, stick them in a locker while I swim, then reverse the process to go home, I can overlook my own fashion faux pas.  The heel strap keeps them properly positioned on my feet while driving, and the drain holes in the toes make them great for poolside.  I have falling arches & these make the walk from car to poolside & back so much less painful than foam flip-flops - and as stated before, I feel confident driving my car (automatic transmission) whereas with flip-flops, I'd change in & out of socks & shoes, while my kids wait for me to get the car started & the A/C going.  If these last half as long as my old Crocs Mammoth clogs (10+ years so far & still have a little bit of tread on the soles), then these are the best deal in footwear for my Fashion Tone-Deaf Curmudgeon Community.  (Life Member since 2013.)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2018

Title: CROCS CLASSIC CLOG
Review: As I said on the recent purchase review of this wonderful shoe, I can't wear any other.  Most ALL other shoes I have ever tried give me back, hip, knee, ankle and foot pain after wearing them for as little as an hour or two.  When I slip into a pair of these, it's like a miracle.I love the color Garnet.  It's actually rather classy looking.  Just purchased a gray pair for my husband, and they look really nice on me, too :)  Might have to order myself a pair of gray soon :)It fits perfectly, except the opening is a little bit smaller than the pairs I bought about 10 years ago.  Yes, I stocked up on them, back then, when I found the white ones locally.  BUT, the good news is, if I order a size larger, it's now a perfect fit.  Found that out when I ordered that pair for my husband, after he saw my newest pair.I also love the fact that you can just wear them in the shower, or throw them in the washer to keep them clean.It's a WONDERFUL shoe_like none other !
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2019

Title: the perfect shoe
Review: Who could say anything bad about a croc? It's one of those shoes where I feel like a significant number of people know what size they are in crocs, but just in case: I am usually between an 8-9 in shoes. These run about half a size larger, although I can wear both an 8 and a 9 in crocs, I like the way the 8 looks better. If you have wide feet and that's a deciding factor for you in getting the larger sizes, you don't have to worry about that because of the wideness of crocs. I'm so glad these are back in style. The white ones especially are a perfect staple shoe for summer. I wouldn't hike in them, but they would be fine as an everyday shoe for sure. They also make a good house slipper for going inside and outside too. we stan
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020

Title: Ugly, but Comfy
Review: So my dad had a pair of these years ago and I found myself putting these on for household tasks whenever I went over to his house.I got married this summer, so now that I can start letting myself go I decided to order a pair for myself. They're great. Super lightweight and comfortable. The only gripe I have is that they run a little big. I wear a size 10.5 and, based on other reviews, I ordered a size down. Even the size 10's fit best with socks. Still very comfortable though.If you find yourself at a point in life where you want comfortable shoes and don't have to impress anyone - I highly recommend these.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2017

Title: Crocs Rule
Review: FIRST- Hot tips for my Amazonians:- Get Prime. Buyer protection. Sort by “Prime” when browsing. Buy with confidence. Two day shipping and NO HASSLE free returns without worry. Don’t like it? Return. Doesn’t fit? Return. Broken? Return it!- Sort by MOST RECENT reviews when looking at an item. Click on reviews at the top - click on reviews again. Sort by Recent instead of Top. You’ll thank me!- Research, Research, Research everything you buy here. Mainly pricing. May be way better somewhere else but watch for added shipping cost if you’re a Prime member. Many items are marked up here to compensate for shipping.- Watch for knockoffs! Believe the reviews that are heavy on the negative. Don’t trust reviews that say “Good product” or “Will buy again” only. They are bought. Look at the pics!NOW - On to the review for these Crocs!Kids LOVE these. My 12 and 14 year old girls wear them out and WEAR THEM OUT. Crocs have been around for years but it’s now a “fashion trend” with the teenie boppers.But don’t let that fool you! Adults are obsessed too. They are super comfortable and long lasting. Great for quick trips to the store or longer walks.Tons of colors. True to size. Get you some!If this was a helpful review, thumbs it up so others can see it too!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020

Title: Crocs are currently on trend, plus they're soooo comfy!
Review: I love my Pink Lemonade color Crocs.  (they are a true pink, as compared to the ballerina pink which is a very pale pink)  I also bought Lemon Yellow,  Electric Pink, and Ice Blue -- all from Amazon.  I wear a women's size 7 in sneakers like Nike & Adidas, so that's what I buy in Crocs, and the fit is perfect.  I never thought I'd be rockin' Crocs, but here I am... and I'm loving them.  PS...  My shipments have all been shipped & received very quickly.  PPS... these are the authentic brand 'Crocs' shoes, and the Amazon price is comparable to the shoe stores, except Amazon has many more colors to choose from & you don't need to leave your house to get them.  If Amazon don't have your favorite color in your size today, just keep checking back.  PPPS... I can't believe how many compliments I've been getting whenever I wear my Crocs -- or how all-day comfy my feet are!  Apparently, Crocs are the hottest "it" shoe to own in your fashion wardrobe these days.  Hard to believe, but true. Lol
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020

Title: I. LOVE. My. Crocs!!!
Review: I love my crocs so unbelievably much. My poor husband absolutely despises them, but too bad! I've got bad fibromyalgia and also lingering foot issues from a fracture a decade ago. I bought the crocs because I can't stand the pain from going barefoot all the time. Let me tell you- If I wear these all day, there's no pain or it's largely decreased. They're so comfortable, supportive, light, and handy! I can wear them out to the garden and then just hose them off. They're quiet enough to wear around the house while the kids are sleeping. I have such bad joint stiffness and pain in the morning, it can be hard to get going...but if I put these on right away, I get right to whatever I need to be doing that day! Now I just need a pair for camping and a pair for at work and an indoors pair and an outdoors pair. Lol. LOVE THEM!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019

Title: Best purchase ever.
Review: I have steered clear of buying crocs, as I assumed it would "show my age" but, having just turned 43, I think I no longer care. I am outdoors working in the yard many hours per day and my pale skin was cooking in my regular uncomfortable $4 flip flops. That, and needing arch support, my feet were aching. Now, my gorgeous grass green crocs protect my fragile skin. The crocs are SO comfy and sturdy I've begun wearing them on the regular for NON outdoor gardening and pool cleaning activities. Even as I precariously balance on the slippery rock formations around the pool, the crocs grip and keep me from sliding into the pool hilariously. 10/10 will buy more. Perhaps a rainbow version?
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020

Title: Must Buy!
Review: I was pretty skeptical about purchasing this shoe, due to the conflicting opinions in fashion.  What is more important, style or comfort?  Well, if you were to ask me that question two weeks ago, my answer would be style without a bit of hesitation.  However, after working eight-plus hour shifts, five days a week, standing only, my mindset – and answer to that question – has definitely changed.  I thought my Nike sneakers would cut it, but I soon realized they provided no support, no natural curvature for the foot to follow, no air circulation.  My knees and feet began to kill, and I decided it might be a good idea to do some research.Clogs.  Clogs?  I know I wanted more practical shoes, but clogs are just not suited for my nineteen-year-old self.  I mean, I still wanted something relatively cute.  But was that possible?  I kept scrolling through the shopping tab of Google, until I saw this pair of crocs.  Now, I remember I sported a bright orange pair in middle school, but I think I outgrew that stage.  Wait, they have a white pair.  Much more mature color.  I decided to take the risk, after all, my I owed it to my feet.Not only did these crocs pull my whole scrub uniform together – I mean what screams healthcare more than scrubs and crocs? – but I managed an entire shift with 99% less foot and knee pain than my previous sneakers had caused.  Another plus, they are “not only the most comfortable shoes, but also easy to clean just using soap and water and allowing for a quick dry.”  Because one of my duties as a pharmacy technician is to pour liquids, it is easy to spill on your shoes.  But, because of the synthetic material, I am able to grab a wet paper towel and wipe the mess right off.  But wait, there’s more.  I’m sure everyone can relate to their feet getting sweaty in sneakers, especially if you are moving around all day.  Well, crocs solve that problem for you.  The holes provide circulation and leave your feet as dry as ever.I totally agree with and support this review!“There is a moderate arch support. I have low arches and my sister-in-law has extremely high arches; neither of us feel like more support is needed” As arch support was one of my main concerns, I can assure that crocs also leave me feeling like my feet are supported properly. I highly recommend purchasing this product, as it has changed my work day experience.  I no longer suffer with severe feet and joint pain that is caused by flat shoes.  These crocs provide just the right amount of support and maintain comfort with the foamy cushion.  If standing on your feet sounds like the majority of your days, then crocs are the shoes that will change your life.  Especially with the color assortment, there’s a shoe to match every outfit!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2019

Title: Excellent for pool deck, locker room, and at home!  Good arch support.
Review: Excellent sandal for walking on the pool deck and in locker rooms!  Good arch support!  Very comfortable. Easy to slip on and off while standing. Nice big toe box. I also wear them at home as slippers, as shoes in warm weather, on grass, on docks, and for canoeing, and kayaking. Lift your foot up and the water drains, out so your feet do not stay wet. On colder days I wear them with socks. I have worn them for many years and I keep buying more of same. Their usefulness and comfort wins out over lack of beauty due to bulky look. I hope they keep making this same classic sandal.  I have to replace them because extended wear on the pool deck concrete smooths the bottom making them slippery. Otherwise they last a long time. I wear them 5 or 6 days a week for hours at the pool while teaching swimming, life-guarding, roving, and while showering in locker room after swimming.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2020

Title: I LOVE MY CROCS.
Review: I was so excited to get the cyan blue crocs on super sale. These are the comfiest shoes ever. The dots on the soles massage your feet, they provide great arch support, they’re such a cute color, and it’s finally long enough past the initial croc trend that they’re ironically stylish again. 10/10 recommend for beach days, days at the pool, rainy days, regular days, lazy days, winter days with socks, or whatever else to want to wear them with. They definitely run large, so try on a friend’s or try them on in the store first if possible. But snag yourself a pair, you won’t regret it!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2018

Title: Perfect in every way
Review: I needed some slip-on shoes to wear while working in my garage (woodworking).  I don’t have a lot of shoes because I have long, wide feet and I have trouble finding ones with a comfortable fit. I had been wearing my work tennis in the garage, but then while I was at my job I would look down and notice sawdust under the laces lol. So, I ordered these and they are really perfect:Easy to slip on and off.Durable.Super lightweight.Waterproof. I can hose them off.And so comfortable! I forget that I’m wearing them. I’ve actually finished shopping before and then realized that I went to the store in my garage Crocs lol.I have huge feet and I wear size 11 in all shoe styles so that’s what I got for these. They are a bit roomy in the width and length, but they still don’t seem bulky when they’re on, my foot does not slide around inside the shoes, and it means I can wear my thick comfy socks under them!I want more! Maybe one pair for working out in the yard. And maybe some lined ones to use as slippers. I definitely want some in cooler colors next!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2019

Title: 2020 should be filled with Crocs.
Review: Ok so I've had a pair for myself and bought pairs for friends they run big & they are actually awesome but the "melon" color looks yellow & its lime green. Not even close to the picture. so bad because of that. It's important to represent accurate description & photos for each.But let's talk about how much puss you'll get with these. If you think these are ugly or bad it's because you ain't got fashion or game. Overall I've bought 8 for different friends and now they are drippin in the streets. If you want a girl to recognize you toss those flowers & buy some crocs. If she doesn't want to be your wife after that then she ain't the one mister. If 2020 wasn't the year of Corona it'd be the year of crocs. Trust. Don't sleep.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2020

Title: These are now my favorite kick-around shoe - even went shopping in Walmart with them and they turned out to be comfy.
Review: Where have these been all my life?  I first discovered a cheap copy of these at Walmart, and I loved how they fit and how easily they slip on and off.  So I was pleased to find the original brand here on Amazon.  I live in the desert, and our home is kept on the warm side too, so I definitely need models (like this classic model) with the holes in the side and top - the one thing I didn't like about my cheap knock-offs is they didn't have those holes, and my feet (with or without socks) were uncomfortably hot and clammy inside the house.  Another good feature is being able to toss the shoes into a bucket of soapy water to clean them after slogging in the mud outside.For me, the strap is crucial.
