Review: I wear these when I'm working. I am on my feet 8-10 hrs a day and these are perfect. My feet don't hurt as much as they would if I was wearing sneakers. Also lets my feet breathe, so my feet don't get sweaty as long as I'm wearing socks.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019

Title: Perfect for the fire station while not on calls.
Review: With the recent covid pandemic in full swing, my job (career ff) was taking steps towards keeping shoes/ boots that we use on calls separate from our day room and common areas. This was my solution to wearing daily at the station while not on calls. Other choose tennis shoes, or some short of sandal or shoe.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020

Title: Perfect house shoes
Review: The color (khaki) is not great, but that was what was available when I ordered. These are for in the house, so who cares? These are replacements for some Crocs I have had over five years. Hard to tell when they wear out, but these new ones support my feet much better. On the arch support question - better than bedroom slippers, less than good athletic shoes. NOTE: Occasionally I will see an adult were Crocs in public - please don't! These are house shoes only!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2016

Title: The shoes are fine and I should be able to wear them for ...
Review: I was used to purchasing Crocs in the "from-to" size range ( 9-10, etc.) so the size setup on these was a bit strange for me. The shoes are fine and I should be able to wear them for quite some time with no problem, but they are a wee bit narrower than my other crocs and since my feet tend to swell a bit in hot weather the narrower width might be a problem. Don't know yet. Otherwise the shoes are great--lovely color (Khaki) is a perfect neutral.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2016

Title: Good product so far
Review: Perfect fit. My feet are exactly 11” long and I ordered size 11 (men). Idk if these are worth $20 more than the Walmart brand, but I’m happy with my purchase, they’re quite comfortable and sturdy.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020

Title: Five stars for comfort but not quality
Review: Just wanted to write a review on this particular pair of crocs. I gave it five stars because they are so comfortable, but I ordered a pair for my son at the end of August, he has wore them to school many days and the strap already broke and we are only into December right now. By the school rules, he is not allowed to wear them at school unless they have a strap on them. Very disappointed as our return window has passed. Normally I feel like crocs last forever but not this pair.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019

Title: Good comfy shoe
Author Name: Hard working mom, not alot of time!
Review: Good shoe overall, however my daughter stated these were snugger than a pair we just bought 2 months ago. They do have a lil stretch over time so they may resolve it.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020

Title: Im in LOVE!!
Review:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   LOVE, LOVE, LOVE these crocs! I ordered my usual size and they came slightly bigger than I was expecting them to, so I threw them in the dryer with a wet towel for about 4min. and they came out perfect! I've never had crocs before and it's my understanding that they're supposed to be larger shoes, but I prefer having a tighter fit. Overall, super comfy, easy to pair with outfits and perfect for a trip to the grocery store, walking the dogs, or going shopping with friends!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2019

Title: Plantar facia help!
Review: I love the Tropical Teal color of my replacement Crocs - very dramatic. I wear a size 8 and the Crocs size M6/W8 fits perfectly. I can wear with or w/o socks (which I'll wear with my Crocs around the house when the weather gets cold). I have both Achilles' and plantar facia pain and the Crocs give my sore feet a break. They last a long time, too - years.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2018

Title: Runs Quite Large
Review: Great classic Croc! It was very large though, so I had to return twice. Ended up with two full sizes below what I wear everyday. I’d suggest ordering a size or two down. Other than that, great classic Croc!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020

Title: Loyal Croc Family
Review: My girls have been raised in Crocs, So this pair was for my 12 year old Middle Schooler !For myself, I have a seriously bad back, bad knee and heal pain, Crocs really help with this.... I know when they need replaced as my feet flair up! I’ve seriously worn Crocs and I remain true to this company!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2019

Title: Great shoes for post op recovery!
Review: My first ever pair of Crocs - life saver for a rough post op recovery after bunion surgery. Must have!The fit - I am 8-8.5 with narrow to medium feet. Ordered these in 9 women - they are too big, but this is perfect for my left foot as i have had substantial swelling after surgery. Feet feel comfy and stable in them. I wear one pair in the shower and the other around the house .
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2020

Title: Great shoe for the beach...
Review: I have to admit I really find the classic Croc unattractive, but incredibly practical under the right circumstances.  I dislike it for an everyday, all day shoe, but great for the beach or gardening.  Of course, my kids love them.  I have slipped on my son's from time to time (we wear the same size) and they are comfortable to walk in, but slippery if the inside gets wet.  The back strap doesn't really hold the heel the way I think a back strap should.Turns out my son wanted a bright color and was not excited about the khaki color, but he wears a lot of khaki shorts and I think it looks great.  He's 9, so for him bright and bold would be better!  The price I got on Amazon was better than at my local Croc store.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2014

Title: Great shoe
Review: Only shoes I can wear...I have neuropathy pretty bad and with these Crocs I can at least function. Wish they weren't so pricey. I usually buy one pair a year.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2020

Title: Perfect
Review: I bought my reg size and it was perfect. They are roomy which is they way they are suppose to be. If your expected them to fit like a reg clog they will not. I will be purchasing another color too.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2020

Title: but they're very comfortable and excellent to wear around the house
Review: I can never say crocs are "beautiful shoes", but they're very comfortable and excellent to wear around the house. I buy a pair and wear them for many years until the bottoms are completely worn out. I've never had a complaint about my crocs. I do suffer from plantar fasciitis so I put inserts in them for additional arch support. It would be awesome to see a pair developed that would make the additional insole support unnecessary.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2016

Title: Best Christmas Present Ever
Review: So my 15 year old has been wanting crocs since school started in July.  Dropping hints left and right and constantly talking about all her team mates and friends that have them. We just ignored her and wrapped these up in a cereal box for Christmas. She was beyond excited and loved the surprise. Parenting win!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020

Title: Nice, a bit wide
Review: a bit wider than expected, but length is good, granddaughter has a narrow foot, THEY'REWHITE !  so expect them to get dirty at every wearing, fortunately they're washable :)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020

Title: Cuuuuute
Review: First pair of Crocs ever and I can definitely say they’re comfortable to wear. True to size , although they did seem to fit wide but it may just be that my foot is thin. Overall a pretty color and I’m excited to finally match charms with my son
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020

Title: Great Buy!
Review: Order a size up. I ordered size 6 and they were too small I ordered size 7 next and they fit perfect. They are VERY comfortable and perfect lazy day shoes. They are good for the beach or lake because you can dunk your feet in the water. Great buy over all.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020

Title: Can’t go wrong with Crocs
Review: I measured my feet and followed the size chart for Crocs. They fit well. I just bought them for around the house, but they are cute. I would wear them out. I was surprised that I liked the color as well - pink.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2020

Title: Best shoes ever!
Review: Don’t hesitate to get crocs! The most comfortable pair of shoes I’ve ever worn. My feet don’t get tired. They are just so easy and comfortable!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020

Title: Crocs. Great price. Nuff said
Review: As expected but has an oily residue coating it Inside that even washing it hasn’t made it go away. I guess continued use will help. Wrong time of year to wear these very often though. Will see when spring comes around if it wears off.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2019

Title: Back in style!!! Teen approved!!
Review: Got these for my teenage niece (14) and she LOVES them! Apparently they are back in style big time! Thank goodness because I’m getting myself a pair with the lining in them:) I use to wear them all the time as a hairdresser and loved them, so happy they are back in style again!!!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2019

Title: Not the same
Review: These Crocs purchased Oct 2020 are made of different material than the previous 3 pair I’ve worn. Instead of soft foam material they are made of a harder plastic. This new pair isn’t breathable and makes my feet sweat. The tight fit in toe and firm plastic have given my toes blisters just being worn around the house.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020

Title: Roomy and Comfortable
Review: These fit feet widened after having children. I use them as house shoes as it is no longer comfortable for me to walk barefoot. I love that my toes are not cramped as the toe box is roomy. These are more comfortable than most of my street shoes.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2019

Title: Size down
Review: These were a gift for my brother who is normally a size 10. They were too loose so we returned them and got a size smaller. Much better!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2020

Title: Comfy Crocs
Review: Excellent for anyone on their feet all day. I bought them as a gift for a favorite waiter who goes the extra mile for us and needed a new work shoe. He's in them every time we see him. Says they make his feet feel like he's walking on clouds!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2019

Title: I've never worn these before!
Review: Just kidding - they're Crocs. If you can get past your friends ridiculing you regularly, and neighbors laughing from a distance when you're walking the dog in these things, then you'll be happy! They're the most functional pair of footwear out there.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020

Title: Fits small. Order a size up.
Review: These have a  cushiony sole and are well made. I got them to wear while I work in the yard and they are perfect for this because I can just rinse them off with the hose when I'm done. I ordered the Women's size 9. I usually wear an 8.5 but I listened to the reviews that said they ran small and boy am I glad I did! My toes just touch the end of the shoe. I would say they are about a 1/2 size too small. If I had to wear them for long periods while standing, they would be uncomfortable pretty quickly. So keep that in mind, if you're going to wear them for 8 hours at work. Overall I'm very happy with them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2017

Title: Ugly but comfortable
Review: Crocs may be absolutely hideous but I wanted to see if they’d make a good house shoe. These are pretty comfy, I’m excited to feel them when they break in a bit. These are supposed to fit a bit loose but seem to stay on pretty well despite that.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020

Title: Super cute!
Review: I was deciding on getting the ballerina pink or the lavender and I'm glad I got the lavender!! It's super pretty and I'll definitely get good use out of them!!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2020

Title: Standard Wear For Sea Kayak Trips--And More!
Review: I love Keens for whitewater, but a kayak trip in Baja on the Vermilion Sea convinced me that these are the best choice for that kind of trip--ALL the guides and staff wore them.I like the heel strap--which can be used to make the Croc more secure, or flipped up to make the Croc function more as a clog.They are versitile--good for getting the morning paper on the wet grass without ruining those sheepskin slippers, great poolside sandals, and of course perfect beach wear.They do run wide, but I have a wide foot.This is my second pair--as we have another kayak trip in Baja coming up!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2013

Title: Something easy to slide on & off.
Review: Like my Crocs...wanted something easy to slide on & off...wanted something to wear around camp that I could also wear while standing in the shower at the campground.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020

Title: Light. Comfortable. Good fit. Stylish.
Review: Perfect width and arch support. Very light. My mom is diabetic and has neuropathy. She felt blessed finding about these. Strong grip. Prevents falls. Very important! And stylish too. Who would've thought it.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020

Title: Big and bright
Review: Very large. Seemed like men’s sizes (or maybe it was just because of the width.) In any case, my daughter didn’t mind that they were loose.The color is bright yellow. Show dirt easily. But as always, great for comfort, and easy on/easy off.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2019

Title: Color is a bit off
Review: The color is like a teal and i expected more of a baby blue. The color is my only complaint but i still love them and will wear them often
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2020

Title: Feels comfy.
Review: I love Crocs they always feel comfy. This clog is no exception but indeed a example of the rule. I wear these more often than I wear any other shoe. Makes my flat feet feel happy. That should tell you something. Get it now!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019

Title: Crocs are the best!
Review: i love crocs when i have to stand for any length of time cooking, etc. When I come home from work i change into them right away in order to relax and get into my evening routine.  I would wear them all the time if I could.  They're wonderful!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2018

Title: get you some
Review: i love them. got them for my son as well. one piece, versatile. i wish the strap was reinforced more. i fear for it to break one day. even then the crocs will still be used if a strap goes.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020

Title: These are great shoes.
Review: These are great shoes......I wore my previous pair for about 15 years...They finally got ragged and i had to purchase another pair. They fit just right, but being new, the little bumps inside were a bit irritating. To solve this problem, i took a drill and used a wire brush attachment to grind them down a little. That made them better. I'm sure in no time they will be just as comfortable as my old ones!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2017

Title: #1 Crocs Fan
Review: Crocs are Crocs, and they will be my favorite beach or adventure shoes always. Unfortunately I lost one of my husband crocs and have to give him a new pair but that is not a problem because have the satisfaction that you paid for what you get which is a WONDERFUL shoe. I bought the Geometric model and it's more gorgeous in person
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2016

Title: I have a great amount of difficulty finding comfortable shoes being one of ...
Review: I have a great amount of difficulty finding comfortable shoes being one of my ankles is fused with pins & screws holding things together so not only is that foot a bit oddly shaped but because of all the trauma to my right leg, I am subject to profound swelling issues.  I am actually not sure about the arch support, but I also can't claim there isn't any, but since there was no option to be non-committal, I opted for the yes.  I do have a brace to wear on that leg with sneakers, but it becomes uncomfortable after a few hours and the clogs are light weight enough for me to use as an alternative both for several hours but also as a quick way to slip on to go outside to get the mail etc as I am mostly barefooted while at home.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2015

Title: Good for Motorhome
Review: My wife & I both got a pair of these crocs.  They are really good around the motorhome.  Easy to slip on and off as we go in & out of the motorhome.  Especially useful when it is wet & messy outside on a grass campsite.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2020

Title: Easy to clean. Fits well.
Review: I was concerned about these being too big with no socks or thin socks but they actually fit perfect. My daughter has a wide foot and has touble typically with shoes but she does not complain about these. They are in style and Crocs is the best brand. The white are easier to clean than I expected also.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019

Title: This is my second pair. My first pair is ...

I'm not replacing pair #1 I just got tired of having to come in after working in the yard all day and having to wash the dirt off of them before I went somewhere. Now I just change into my new pair. At the rate pair #1 is going I should not have to buy a new pair for maybe 10 more years. F I live that long!

Title: Great shoes!!

Title: Quality

Title: Comfortable!

Title: Walking on a cloud

Title: I purchased a pair of crocs as a GIFT. ...
Review: I purchased a pair of crocs  as a GIFT.  I just found out that they don't fit.  bought them according to chart.  went online to EXCHANGE THEM.  only to find out too late to return.  So there they set unworn.  All I saw when I ordered was they could be returned  no  time frame.  She likes the way they look but that isn't anygood if they don't fit !!  All I WANT TO DO IS  EXCHANGE  TH.EM FOR THE CORRECT SIZE.  Not a RefundIf you can help me with this problem it would be appreciated.  Thank youMy suggestion to anyone  When you are buying for a GIFT  don't buy till last minute if it concerns  the SIZE.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2017

Title: If your old Crocs are sized “8-9, 9-10,” etc. order news ones in the larger size shown
Review: I bought these a replacement for my old worn out classic Crocs, which were getting slippery on wet surfaces due to the worn out tread. The old sizing was “W10-11 M8-9” while new Crocs have whole sizing. If you’re looking for the same size in a new classic Croc go for the larger number (in this case W11 M9) to get the same size as your originals.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019

Title: Fits great and Great price.
Review: Love the Crocs.  They are very comfortable and wear out slooooowly.  :)  I noted my orthopedic surgeon wears them, and also my Internist.  If they are good enough for doctors.... they are good enough for me.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020

Title: Great House Shoes
Review: I bought these crocs to replace my house slippers. They are light and comfortable. I used to love to be barefoot every chance that I got, until I developed plantar fascitis. My cure has involved wearing supportive shoes and never being barefoot. These crocs are great for wearing around the house. They are extremely lightweight and provide excellent cushioning for my feet.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2020

Title: Pretty, sturdy
Review: Pretty color, quite popular.  Crocs fit loose and these classic clogs are no exception.I only buy Croc brand because the cheaper knock offs quickly end up with a broken strap and worn bottoms that become quite slippery.My daughter is quite happy with her crocs
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2019

Title: Great Christmas Present from Husband!
Review: My husband bought these for me after I have been stealing his to wear in our basement.  These are so comfortable to wear for hours every day and are even better on my feet that they are actually the right size!  Part of our basement is unfinished and where our washer/dryer is and also our woodstove so we head to the basement quite frequently every day.  It is great to have a pair of shoes that you can slip on pretty quickly and go.  My feet are ALWAYS sore at the end of the night as well and these seem to have good enough support that my feet aren't as bad by the time I go to bed. Very happy with this purchase!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2014

Title: Love the color
Review: Perfect fit and great color. Great packaging and on time.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020

Title: Great for puppy potty runs in the backyard
Review: When Crocs first were introduced back when I was a kid, my mom and I would constantly call these "the ugliest garden shoes we'd ever seen." However, fast forward to when we got our first puppy who has to make countless potty runs at all hours of the night, and these are the most appreciated shoes! They slip on and off without having to lift a finger, and they are incredibly light weight. They are the perfect shoe for roaming around the yard, where no one can see your silly "garden shoes"! But really, in all honesty, we love our Crocs for making puppy potty runs!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2015

Title: Great Croc!
Review: Great Croc! Yup the real makoy! This being said, perfect for around the garden as slip ons! But for heaven's sake people, stop wearing these out in public! They are ugly! As designed! Maybe for young children? Adult's around the house only! Your slippers too!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2019

Title: Crocs are awesome

Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2020

Title: I love these CROCS which I bought for myself!!!
Review: This is a roomy, comfortable shoe that I'm proud of so I gave it a 5-star rating. It's also easy to slip them on and off. I liked the price and free shipping which allowed me to save without waiting too long for them to arrive. These CROCS were made in Mexico and are a good fit as I expected. I recommend these to anyone who likes comfort and good fit.  My granddaughter works in an electrical plant which requires her to wear these shoes, so I recommend them to anyone who is required to wear them for work also. BTW, I don't believe these shoes are good for working outdoors doing yardwork as the soles are not intended for that purpose.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2013

Title: The everyday, everything shoe
Review: Perfect. Just as described. I’ve never seen a teen smile so big, And for those of us with teen kids we know that is a great accomplishment

Title: ... they must have been too big because I didn't enjoy them as much

Definitely size your feet as i did and they fit perfectly. I wanted something I could quickly slip on around the campsite getting in and out of my tent. It's cold out so I am actually using them around the house and they are so comfy!

I was worried they would be clumsy and not stay on my feet without the straps but it's just the opposite.  So happy I bought these.

I wanted a pair of slip ons that are comfy and withstand all the chaos my daily routine around the house brings. These did not disappoint. So comfy, I forgot I am wearing them. My feet feel great and I am a hooked crocs lover.

Title: Super comfortable and lightweight!

Title: Crocs save the day
Review: Love them.  Because of a botched surgery, my foot is deformed and I cannot wear normal shoes. I lived in Crocs for a long time.  I've been unable to walk without assistance for a long time, and it occurred to me that I needed to replace them, but the pair I had was purple, and it matched a lot of things in my world, clothes, my car! So I just knew that I had to replace them. I couldn't even read the size on the bottom they were so worn.  I couldn't find them in the size I needed due to swelling in my feet so I had to order a larger size.  Luckily they were available in my second favorite color.  I'm walking so much better!  Happy Mother's Day to me!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2017

Title: Comfy

I was standing for around 8-9 hours, and I typically do for work as well, but was given the same level of comfort as my work shoes. Very nice.

Title: Arrived ahead of schedule, good price $20.00

Title: Comfy, Wear Everywhere

As this was my first pair of Crocs I figured I had nothing to lose at such a bargain price. What I didn't realize is how much I had to gain! I really, really like them!Crocs advises that half-sizes order the whole size down: I wear a US 9.5 shoe and ordered these in US 9: They are easily the equivalent of a US 10. Be aware that other styles vary in size: The Baya style, for example, offers a much closer fit - both in width and length.

Title: Great Crocs

My only complaint (really not a complaint), is that the shoe has several openings, so if I go outside to sweep my porch the dust will get into the shoe and under my feet. For this reason I also wear a lightweight pair of socks.

Title: BUY CROCS, (especially white ones)

I will definitely buy these again in the future. Like seriously, BUY WHITE CROCS. I promise you, you will love them. Just don't get the wrong size like I did (I sold them to my brother so it's all good, he liked them that much). I tell everyone to buy them, including my math teacher.

Title: Crocs

Title: Super Comfy!

Title: Comfortable!!

Title: Great “shoes”

Most of the guys at the fire station are wearing them also since we aren’t allowed to wear our boots in the station now.  I highly recommend them!

Title: They run somewhat bigger than normal shoes. I’m a size 8 in sneakers and a 7 in crocs

Title: Love these!
Review: Love crocs! So comfortable and very supportive. They are lightweight and super easy to clean. Best prices on Amazon too. Highly recommend!

Title: Another great pair of Crocs
Review: I have worn Crocs for years.  Most comfortable thing I have ever had on my feet!  This is just another fine pair of crocs.  Can be worn outside or as an inside slipper.  I wear mine outside mostly walking.  I usually walk over 5 miles a day.  Have bought expensive walking shoes over the years.  Anything I buy usually needs replacement after 2 to 3 months.  I am very hard on shoes.  These Crocs last just as long, yet only 1/3 to 1/4 the cost.  I can stand for hours in these too, without legs, hips, or feet aching.I also wear Mammoths when it is cold.  I do have to admit that I wear a hunting boot while hunting or serious woodland hiking and a snow boot in deep snow:^)  But other than those, Crocs are the only other footwear I own.

Title: So happy with this purchase!

Title: Ugly but the most comfortable shoes I have EVER had!

Title: Love it!
Review: This is soooo comfortable! I wear a 7.5 and went with an 8. The shoe fits a little on the loose side but not so much that it affects walking. Definitely recommend.

Title: Good to youe feet, and cute too

Title: Love

Title: Lasting (small) Comfort.

Title: We love our crocs

Title: Great

Title: Husband loves them!

Title: love them
Review: easy to get on an off love that they are like walking on cloud as its nice and soft under foot would buy again for sure

Title: They work!!!!
Review: I was having problems with left ankle pain - to the point that the burning would keep me awake at night. All those years of commuting by bus and train took its toll. My podiatrist recommended I get some Crocs to wear around the house. I am now pain free. I had the tendency to go barefoot when I got home, liking the freedom of "free feet". With Crocs, my freedom is not inhibited and I don't know what I would do without them. Immediately on taking off my street shoes and stockings, I slip into my Crocs and don't mind them at all. Thank you, Dr. Daley and the Crocs people. I am now OTC pain killer free.

Title: Good product. I deploy to bases with "public use" ...
Review: Good product. I deploy to bases with "public use" showers that everyone uses and this keeps your feet off the ground and clear of the mildew and other unmentionables on the shower floor. They turn white after a while a crack with constant hydration and dehydration of actually taking them into the shower but after 4-6 months of use, I would probably throw them away in that environment anyway no matter how they looked. Very comfortable to wear and just the thing for deployments. Sandals flop around too much.

Title: I've been converted!

Title: Perfectly Pepper

But after a day of swimming with my friend they all slipped on their crocs and it took me a whole 5 minutes to get my socks and shoes on, I said "no more" and order a pair that are my school colors, pepper, right when I got home. I am usually a 9.5 and I did as suggested by going down half a size but they are actually a bit big; however, with the sport strap, they fit perfectly! I really like them but I have high arches and the arch support is not the best.

The size was a little larger than expected, but not unreasonable.  I'm actually glad they are a little larger in hopes that the added size will help improve airflow.  I've owned this pair for about a month and they seem to be holding up ok.  I was much happier to pay the Amazon price as opposed to what the store was asking.  I just hope it's the same quality; only time will tell.

Title: I'm very pleased with these Crocs
Review: I'm very pleased with these Crocs. Never had Crocs before, and I was hesitant about looking goofy, but these are the best knock-arounds I've had in years. I struggle finding slides that will stay on my feet, but these are great—they have the strap thingy in the back that also rotates to the front if you don't need it. Even without the strap, these stay on my feet better than any other slides I've owned. And the support is terrific—the first time I wore them I took a 2.5 mile walk and they were extremely comfortable. They run a little large. I usually wear a men's 10.5, but they don't have half sizes, so I got 10s. They fit great, and if anything might be a bit large. Inexpensive, durable, easy to clean, great for doing yard work, shopping, or whatever.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2017

Title: Lived Up to the Hype.
Review: Crocs really are the coolest. Not only was I able to score a pair for a mere $23.00, but they are true to size and are the best shoes for those of us who enjoy the ability of slipping shows on and off. Just be forewarned, when you first get them they will have a weird “wet” feeling. It will go away really Quickly though, in about a day or less. All in all, this was a great purchase and I would definitely buy them again in another color if I wasn’t so “thrifty-nifty.” :)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020

Title: So much better than the knockoffs!
Review: I wish they made 1/2 sizes, but the size 11 works fine.  I really like how thick the sole is compared to the knockoffs I had before.  Night and day.  We recently hiked 32 miles in three days with backpacks on the AT (Appellation Trail) in the smokey mountains.  One of my friends wore Crocs the whole way.  I couldn't believe it.  I thought he was "the man".  Finally we traded, and I understood.  His sole was easily 3 times thicker than mine.  Until then, I couldn't understand how he could walk over all those rocks with just Crocs.  Now I understand!

Title: Most Comfortable Shoe In The World

Very comfortable and not too roomie.  So glad I decided to go up on sizing instead of down.I have owned a lot of the knock-off brands in the past and I can honestly say that comfort-wise, they do not hold a candle to real Crocs. Title: I used to be such a hater but man these comfy

Title: Love kicking around the house and garden in these

I've wondered about Crocs but have never tried them before. A friend mentioned she used them to garden in and I decided to order a pair. I'm very satisfied. They're comfortable, easy to slog on and off, and because of all the holes, my feet remain cool. The 9M is on the roomy side, but my feet are more wide than narrow. Still, they stay on my feet without use of the back strap. Good purchase!

Title: I like my crocs!

I usually wear Birks, but I like to wear crocs around the house so I don't have to switch shoes if I'm gardening or washing dogs outside.  And when I bruised the bottom of my feet I needed to wear softer shoes for several weeks and crocs fit the bill.

Title: Great comfort for my flat wide feet.

I always laughed at the aesthetics of the these things but once I tried them I don't care how odd they look. My biggest fear is that they will change them or stop making them.

Title: Perfect

Title: You made me love you. I didn't want to do it. I REALLY didn't want to do it!
Review: Okay, so, let me get this review started off by saying I hate the way the original crocs look. I know, I know, so do a lot of people, but I really hate the way they look. I have always had large feet for a woman (10/10.5), so I really don’t like shoes that emphasize the fact that I am walking around with feet that could double as water skis at a moment’s notice.  As many of you have observed, these shoes are not very good at minimizing the appearance of the size of feet they are on.Okay, so now that I have my fussing out of the way, I love my crocs. To the point where if my house was on fire and I could save one pair of shoes, I would save my crocs.I was first introduced to crocs when I was 20 after I developed an almost crippling case of plantar fasciitis due to working a retail job where I wore heels on hard tiled floor for 10+ hours, 5-6 days a week. I could barely walk without being in excruciating pain. Not fun. I went to see a podiatrist who didn’t do any of the useful things most would have done like offering the night splints or anything like that. He said that I could do a series of injections in my feet, which sounded oh-so appealing, or I could do some stretches, stay off my feet as much as possible, and try wearing crocs whenever I could. I took option b.  I started wearing my crocs from the moment that I got up, until I had to go to work, where I now had a doctor’s note saying that I had to have comfortable, flat shoes.  I didn’t wear the crocs to work, that would have been pushing it, but I did wear the most comfortable shoes I could without making my department manager’s eye twitch when she looked at them. Then, as soon as I got home, I would take them off, and put my crocs back on. The pain lessened almost immediately, and while it was a combination of keeping off my feet, the stretches, and the crocs, the shoes were definitely the most important factor. They helped so much that I wore them outside of the house while running errands. Within a month, the pain had gone from an all-day, all-consuming factor, to something bothered me for only one hour after waking. After two months, I didn’t even need to wear them anymore, so I stopped.Fast-forward five and a half years and I am pregnant with my first child and the crocs came out yet again. They were my best friends during the second and third trimester and I haven’t put them up since. For some reason, probably partially due to the way I sleep, which allows my muscles in my calves and ankles to tense up really well, I have had a mild problem ever since having my daughter. It isn’t debilitating like the first time, it only hurts for about 10 minutes when I first get up in the morning and I am stretching my muscles out, but I wear my crocs at all times when I am in the house.  My husband, whom I met after my first experience with crocs teased me about them quite a lot. He is European and thinks that crocs are some bizarre American fashion statement and had an excellent time laughing at them. But he also has a job where he is on his feet all day, and a month ago he started showing symptoms of plantar fasciitis. I gave him my crocs to wear around the house, remember, I have giant feet, and they went up a size due to my pregnancy to boot (11) , and he has wears a 10.5 in men’s shoes, so while mine were a little tight, they were comfortable enough. He stopped giving me any grief after he spent a few days clomping around the house in my bright purple crocs. After I peeled myself off the floor after a very satisfying guffaw I got him to admit that they were really helping and that he didn’t want to walk around without them anymore. Victory is mine! So, because I wanted me crocs back, guess what he got for Christmas? A lovely pair of plain, black crocs all his own.Now, I’m not a doctor or nurse of any kind, but I can tell that these have really helped my husband and I ease the pain from, and in my earlier case eliminate, a painful condition. Are they pretty? No. Have they worked for us? Yes.I have a pair of size Women's 11 crocs right now and they are perfect for walking around the house, but they are a bit loose, I wouldn't want to try to sprint in them. I have wide feet, and they are perfectly roomy, not tight at all.I bought my husband a Men's size 10, he usually wears a 10.5, and they are a little roomy for him as well, but not to the point where it is an issue. So, judging from my experience, these run a little large and wider than average.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2016

Title: Roomy but comfortable
Review: As other purchasers have noted, the sizing of Croc brand clogs is off. I would guess that these and the pair of Croc Sport clogs are a full size larger than the number sizing would indicated. Because these are clingy to the foot, they don't shift around despite the sizing so we chose not to exchange for a smaller size. Previous non-Croc branded clogs we've owned shrank over time, especially when exposed to a lot of sun so it is possible that Croc brands do the same and account for the generous sizing. Overall, the build quality is quite good and these Crocs are comfortable.

Title: Best ever!
Review: I love my crocs! They were my first pair actually and now I can’t seem to know what I ever did before them lol they honestly feel like clouds on your feet. I use them for work since they are so light and comfortable. I love them!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020

Title: Very Comfy
Review: I bought these as a gift but I have the same pair and they are very comfortable with light arch support
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020

Title: I love my Crocs
Review: I have been wearing Crocs for 20 yeari. I like them and I like this pair. They suit my lifestyle. You can wear them in water, wash them in the dishwasher, just like brand new.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019

Title: WISH THEY WERE AVAILABLE WHEN I WAS A KID!
Review: Clogs beat slippers hands down! I wear them with socks most of the time I'm lounging around the house in winter and know I can wear them outside for brief errands and not have to change footwear. With the socks they're warm in winter; without socks in summer, just right. I even wear them boating and swimming! They float in the water if they come off. Great for when the water's bottom is slimy, pebbly or mucky. Virtually no maintenance and wear like steel.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2016

Title: Cute and Comfy
Review: When I received my crops they came in a clear packaging. The shoes really do fit true to size. At first they may fit a little snug at the tip of your toes but the first time you wear them they will adjust to your feet. I ordered the color “Blossom”. Real cute on my feet and super comfy. It’s like I’m walking on foam.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020

Title: They're great!
Review: I wear these crocs around the house.....I have a foot issue so need to insert my orthotics inside.  But I love them.  I never wear them outdoors so they will stay clean and not dirty up my abode.  I know they're great for outdoor use also but I don't have a yard anymore so for me it's not necessary.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2018

Title: The fit I remember.
Review: Crocs are about the only shoes I wear due to my wide foot and particularly high arch. My last pair of crocs were a different style and they were considerably narrower. I was delighted that these were the comfortable width I was used to with previous pairs. I held back one star because the footbed feels thinner than it used to be... walking on a gravel path these feel more like a year old pair than brand new. Still, very happy.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2016

Title: Incredibly comfortable
Review: There was a time when I might have been embarrassed to be seen wearing such a gawky shoe but having achieved the ripe old age of 66 those times are past. These shoes are very very comfortable, with great support for the entire foot. They do run a bit large so I think I could have gone down a half size. Since they are a clog, however, with the grippy bottom, I have not felt like they would slip off. A bonus that they can get soaking wet with no problem. Wish I had discovered them sooner
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2015

Title: I live in these things!
Review: I pretty much live in my crocs. Only thing that healed plantar for me. This was a good deal, about $10.00 less than Crocs website.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020

Title: Comfy and Weirdly Satisfying
Review: Not sure why it took me so long to buy a pair of Crocs. They're awesome. I bought these specifically to take the dog out, since I'm not about to walk around in wet grass in any of my other shoes. But I'm finding these are just great house shoes in general.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2019

Title: great shoe and very comfortable
Review: These crocs are very comfortable. the inner sole had little texture which makes wearing them without socks uncomfortable. they are very durable and the price is very reasonable. do yourself a favor and buy these nice shoes. also to get cheap figets just order fake ones off of amazon
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2019

Title: Great crocs!
Review: My daughter really wanted these and she can't take them off her feet. Fit well, soft, stylish. Must have!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020

Title: Perfect for my diabetic feet
Review: Received 2 pairs. 1st pair size 13 too large although my regular shoe size. 2nd pair size 12 fit perfect. Love these. I use at gym from locker room into shower. I am diabetic  with sensitive feet.Just what doctor ordered.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2019

Title: Crocs are back!
Review: Crocs are back, people! I bought these for my niece and she loves them. The color is vibrant and lovely. They fit true to size and she wears the most every day
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020

Title: VERY COMFORTABLE
Review: I love the Crocs, I have been wearing them for years for sore feet. I first saw them being worn by a chef on TV and thought they were rather unattractive but decided to try a pair anyway. Boy am I glad I did, they're super comfortable and with the fur lined ones I'm able to wear them year around. They are especially light weight and they do have arch support. In the summer I wear ones with vents in the top and sides, they're as light as flip-flops but offer protection for my feet.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2015

Title: Awesome crocs!!
Review: Awesome crocs. Will buy again...son loved them to this day still wears them. Definitely will buy again and again!! Seller sent fast and did good job!! Thanks
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2020

Title: Ugly but useful
Review: Just use these to go to the beach and they work fine. I finally had to replace my original crocs as they wore out. These are a tad shorter than my original pair, but they are still ok as I’m not walking a lot
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020

Title: Addicted to my crocs!!
Review: I love my crocs! I never thought I would buy these because I never thought I would have any use for them, but I sure was wrong. I needed a pair of shoes to just throw on an wear them around my dorm. My friend convinced me that crocs were the perfect solution. I ordered them and they came on time for a pretty reasonable price. I also got some jibbitz to accessorize them and make them unique to myself. The jibbitz also help me to know which ones are mine when distinguishing them from other pairs of crocs. I now have power ranger jibbitz and a really cool alligator jibbit that looks like it is swimming. The purchase of crocs was one of my best decisions and I get a lot of compliments on them. The other day I saw someone with hot pink ones and I think that might be my next purchase.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2018

Title: love crocs
Review: I love crocs.  I have problems with bunions and arch support.  These crocs are perfect for allowing enough room for my toes and the molded arch gives me great support.  Sometimes I wear the strap in front and they are more of a flip flop.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020

Title: Absolutely..
Review: Love them! They’re a little big but that’s my fault for ordering a size too large. Im an 8’1/2 but they don’t go between sizes. The little loop makes it so the croc doesn’t come off my foot which is great. Great shoes for hot days.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2019

Title: Good
Review: Got these for my husband who will have back surgery soon and I wanted him to have slip ons as we have all tile in the house. He likes them with socks or without.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020

Title: Should’ve brought a bigger size.
Review: I have a similar pair in silver the same size. However my silver ones fit me just a tad bit larger and a tad bit wider making it more comfortable while I have the black ones I just bought I can feel the inside of the croc like it’s rubbing against the bottom of my feet. No pain just different from my other crocs. but all in all they are comfortable
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2020

Title: Husband's Shoes
Review: I can't rate these shoes because they are my husband's. I can only say that he is very pleased with the fit and feel of his crocs and would certainly buy them again.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2020

Title: I don't care how many times i've been told how ugly these are. They are comfy!
Review: The first pair I had were a knock off brand and I got these hoping they would last longer. It's been at least a year and they have. I mainly wear these around the house and the patio. I have bad knees and the cushion in these really help. They are really light weight also. Barely seems like you are wearing anything. I like wearing them while I'm cooking (careful of hot liquid, won't protect from burns) or doing dishes. Also good when you have to be on your feet a long time cleaning and vacuuming. Not good on hot days. Wear with socks if you plan to wear them all day. The grip on the sole is much better than the off brand ones. Still won't wear them on wet ground after slipping badly with my old ones. I do use them as pool shoes though. Buy them a little bigger than you would think because if they are too tight and you wear them without socks you can get blisters easily. My friends kid wears these all the time and he gets blisters because he runs in them. The off brand ones I originally bought i told myself they were for gardening. After slipping a few too many times and being freaked out by bugs crawling in the little holes and I don't use them for that anymore. I have been told many times how ugly these are and i tell the people to try mine on and see how comfy they are. They agree and then say not to wear them in public ha ha.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2014

Title: Great, order a size down
Review: We love our Crocs, only thing is that you have to ORDER 1 SIZE DOWN. So if you're an 8, go with a 7. They run large it seems. We ended up exchanging them and it was fairly easy!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2020

Title: Good Item
Review: Good buy. Shipped promptly. Thanks. In general (for me) most Crocs tend to be a bit small and/or snug if your feet or ankles swell at all. So personal preference I usually do size up one unless an extra wide fitting style.I am a  5 1/2 - 7 in W shoes, narrow feet but prefer wide width for bit extra room and comfort.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2018

Title: Stylish and Comfy
Review: My daughter said these are so comfortable. They look great also, I just love the mustard color. (Definitely the authentic Crocs)
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2020

Title: thanks
Review: thanks
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2020

Title: Best for plantar fasciitis
Review: I like crocs for work.  I am on my feet all day.  These don't have any cushion, so they aren't going to be the most comfortable shoes ever, but after a day on my feet...they don't hurt.  I have been wearing crocks for 5 years now.  I used to have plantar faciitis, really bad....I haven't since wearing crocs.  I have tried to go to a more attractive, cushioned shoe, but within two days of wearing them....my plantar faciitis returns, not bad, because I immediately start to wear my crocks and it goes away.  So I have given up and am only going to wear these to work.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2013

Title: ... sizing is the same as another pair that I love - there really is no problem in wearing jthem
Review: I rated these 'somewhat large' but the sizing is the same as another pair that I love - there really is no problem in wearing jthem.  This contrasts with other brands where  an 8M ( my regular shoe size)  was a full 1 1/2 in too small.  The strap iin back keeps them anchored with no problem (a real consideration since I'm just recovering from a broken ankle).  I love crocs and wear them througout the summer with no socks.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2016

Title: Appear to be good quality for a much better price
Review: I love crocs and wear them at work. Prices have gone up while quality is not as food since mfr moved to China. So, I struggle with finding something that feels sturdy and wears well. I just got these today, and they fit great. So far so good!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2019

Title: My Purple Crocs💜💜💜
Review: I freaking enjoy these. They are my first cross ever so I love them. And they comfy and the purple is sooooo nice 🥰💜🥰💜🥰💜🥰💜
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020

Title: Difficulty in ordering.
Review: Difficult time getting to these crocs without going through Amazon Fashion but I eventually found them.  Also no wide widths only normal and medium.  That is why they only get 4 stars.  Wore them yesterday and my feet felt good.  Extra size bigger to get a wider shoe.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2018

Title: Good for Short Walks (dogs/chores)
Review: Bought these to walk the dogs throughout the day (usually for 20 minutes). Also use them when watering plants/shrubs outside, getting mail, or throwing out trash.  More comfortable than flip-flops as they provide no arch support and you can't really walk fast in them.  Have not worn them longer than one hour.  They fit as expected b/c the description does say they run a little large.  I normally wear a 6.5 so I purchased the Women's 6 US.  You have to get used to the cushioning/padding inside.  They're textured with little plastic nubs that massage your soles as you walk. B/c I don't wear socks, when I take them off and walk on the carpet, there's a strange sensation on the soles of my feet. Not really a complaint, but I can see why it might not be ideal for all-day wear.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2015

Title: My husband had a pair and loved them so much
Review: My husband had a pair and loved them so much , we bought for my father-in-law. He wears them all the time because of the comfort and ease of putting them on. They can be dressed up or just for going in the garden around the house. I would recommend these shoes for anyone looking for comfort.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2018

Title: My son loves them
Review: Bought for my son who is in culinary class at school. He loves these.. slip resistant and comfortable

Title: Love the color, not supportive but did not expect it to be

Title: Great as usual

Title: Love These...Don’t Buy Any Other Brand

After wearing these Crocs, we won’t be buying anything different again. They both love them and wear them alot. My daughter has issues with ingrown toenails and these are comfortable for her...also suggested by her dr. Love these!

Title: I used to be anti-crocs. I was wrong

Title: Go down a size

Title: Large. Size down needed.

Title: My feet feel great.

These are a new, different color but same style as before. They are amazing! We have tried other brands before as well, but crocs are great, non slip when pavement is wet, comfortable, wearable inside and out... GREAT! Love these and will continue to buy them each time they wear out.

Title: DO IT!! Buy them

Title: Best shoe EVER!

Title: LOVE Them!

Title: Excellent shoes
Review: Wonderful shoes for my big hubby with foot problems.  Recommended by my foot Specialist.  Highly recommended.

Title: A classic that has not changed.
Review: I prefer to wear shoes around the house; but I have "outside" and "inside" shoes.  These fit the bill for "inside" shoes.  I can wear them with socks (winter) or with out (summer).  They are great for using in the kitchen.  I  cook a lot and it's not out of the norm to get something on them.  A quick scrub in the utility sink and they are good to go.  I usually get a new pair every other year (they do get worn out).  Love the Garnet color!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018

Title: Granddaughter loved them
Review: I bought these for my granddaughter and she loved them. I thought the price was too high for rubber shoes but I guess these are coming back in style for teenagers. As long as she was happy with them I guess that’s all that matters.

Title: Durable and comfy
Review: I bought these over two years ago and they’re still working well after Daily use.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020

Title: Great cheap minimalist Crocs
Review: The basic Crocs design, which this model represents, is classic. I use it exclusively as my indoors 'shoe'--when I enter the house, my outside (dirty) shoes come off and the Crocs go on. They're also waterproof, so you can use them in the shower, or at the pool or beach, if you wish. I bought my first pair 5 years ago, and it's indestructible; I only bought this second pair because I needed it to use on vacation. The shoe sizes are generous--I'm a size 12 but wear a size 11 Crocs--so it might pay to try on a few sizes in a store before purchasing it.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2013

Title: Had to send back for next bigger size.
Review: Nice but too small in length.  I sent them back and bought the next size up and that worked out great.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020

Title: My friends make fun of me, but I’m too comfy to care
Review: I bought these as house shoes, yknow the ones you throw on to check the mail or take the dogs out. The house shoes you put on after a long day and you just wanna lounge about.What started as a pair of at home shoes only, turned into out and about errand shoes. I love these things, and though they are absolutely ugly, I love them the way people love pugs for their ugliness. 10/10 comfort.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020

Title: Love them
Review: This is my first pair of crocs I’ve owned and I love them! They are quick to put on and they are comfortable too. Would definitely buy again.

Title: They Fit!

Title: They have rare sizes

Title: Good shoe!
Review: A little big but not overly big. Love the massaging ridges inside. I wear a 9-9.5 and size 10 was good.

Title: Great as a gift
Review: I gave these as a gift and they loved. I didn’t realize how small they would look I got a size 6 in women’s and they look like a kids shoe(sooo cute lol) I would definitely order again but this time more so for me next time

Title: Look stupid, be comfy
Review: This is my fourth set of Crocs clogs, and apparently they're running a little smaller than they used to. That, or my feet got longer. I wish Crocs came in half sizes, but oh well.Comfortable & convenient, but don't wear these if you're doing any real walking. Blister city on the top of a foot sans socks. If anything, the worst thing I can say about these plastic shoes is they wear out faster than most other shoes. At least they're priced cheap enough I don't mind having to replace them every year (or less).
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2014

Title: Silly
Review: Ridiculous, right? That’s the point. They make me smile while gardening or doing other light yard work. I don’t wear them off my property because I look like a duck. When they get too dirty to bring inside I hose them off first. Gotta keep them offensively-bright yellow!

Title: Gotta love the crocs!
Review: Love my crocs. They got like a glove and are my “go-to” shoes, especially now throughout my pregnancy.

Title: Genuine Comfortable Crocs
Review: Bought these as my first pair of Crocs, absolutely love them. They're exactly what you'd expect with a pair of Crocs. They fit my true size perfectly, so if you're in between sizes, probably go a size up.

Title: First time Croc owner 😆
Review: My sister got me these for my birthday! I never considered buying Crocs and I always made fun of my family wearing them. They’re light weight, comfortable and I like the blue color. Not a big fan of how they look but will keep wearing them stout the house.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020

Title: More comfortable than expected!
Review: This is the first pair of crocs that I purchased because I don't care for the style. I purchased them for around camp when backpacking and now I wear them around the house daily. We have hardwood floors and they are super comfy and keep my feet from hurting. I take a size 8 and they were true to size. They are made to be roomy but I would not down size because they are made to fit loose and I wear them with and without socks.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2019

Title: Comfy & cute! Pregnant Lady Approved 👍🏼
Review: I was on the fence about the sizing since I kept reading to size up if you’re a half size (women’s 9.5) & I ordered a 10. Definitely size up! It feels true to size for sure. I ordered these for my pregnancy & they definitely feel great!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2020

Title: Prefect Size 8
Review: I wear a size 8 and the Crocs fit perfectly. The strap keeps the shoe securely on my feet. The plastic is comfortable and soft. I can wear them with socks or barefoot.I'm recuperating from a broken ankle and my left foot swells a bit. I needed a shoe that accommodates that swelling.These crocs are perfect during the day and they remain perfect in the evening when they accommodate my swollen foot and my regular foot.

Title: Good Value, Good Quality, Nice Shoes
Review: My daughter has two pair of Crocs that she loves. One from the Crocs website and one from Amazon. There's no difference in quality and they shipped quickly. She loves them! Very comfortable and the color selection is fun!

Title: Amazing for standing long hours

Title: These fits as expected & seem comfortable. This is my first time buying Crocs because ...
Review: These fits as expected & seem comfortable. This is my first time buying Crocs because I was looking for a new type of shoe to wear around the house rather, than flip flops or western boots, so Im trying these. The sole has a bumpy texture, which im not used to, but if I can get used to that I think these will work great. The plastic on the outside seems decently solid while the inside is semi spongy & comfortable. Since im rough on my foot wear this is a bonus. Hopefully these will last a little while!

Title: Comfortable and rather fancy.

He prefers the simpleness of Crocs Classic Flip-Flop or Classic Slide. Although the color looks a little different compared to the one shown in photo (the one my dad received has a greener tone to it), but it is still acceptable. Crocs shoes are divided into three types: roomy fit, relaxed fit, standard fit. This shoe has a roomy fit and it fits my dad as expected. On top of that, I got it on sale, so yay for me!

Title: Most fashionable? Not really. Comfortable, practical, and durable? Definitely.
Review: Awesome shoes. Adjust the swiveling back securing foot strap and you can wear it all day like any other sandal. I've tried very hard to make them slip off and I couldn't get them to slip off accidentally. Leave the swiveling back securing foot strap towards the front of the shoe and you have a quick and easy slip op show or sandal. The shoe's design is very airy. Obviously you feet will get cold on a cold day, but it's refreshing. I would buy it again, but it's unlikely that'll i'll have to buy another because the Crocs feel solidly built and durable.Note that the shoe is typically larger that average shoe sizes, but frankly it's not a big deal. Mine was a bit larger than my actual foot, but the loose feel is very nice. The shoes don't come off even though they are a tad big.

Title: 1st time crocs owner -Great fit, great buy
Review: This is my first pair of crocs. I wear a 10.5 to 11 so I got an 11. I am very happy with the fit. The strap in the back is keeping my foot in the shoe. I am worried about the width getting wider once I break them in, but I'm not sure that will even happen. Again, this is my first pair of crocs. So far, I am very satisfied.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2020

Title: Classic Croc
Review: Classic Croc. Quality seems as good as previous crocs. The fit was perfect. If you are unfamiliar with these shoes they are great shoe for gardening, errands, hospital stays, boats, beaches, and any situation you need a cleanable slip on shoe. Every pair our family has had has been very durable.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2018

Title: Go-to shoe
Review: Fits majorly large, last time I wore a size 9 men's shoe I was probably 12 years old. I understand they are meant to be worn with plenty of room for your foot, but I don't really like that setup...too floppy.Though once I found the right size, these things are perfect. My wife wears hers exclusively indoors as 'slippers' because they are so comfortable and wants to get an outdoor pair now.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2016

Title: Comfortable

He says they're so comfortable and he now understands why people love them so much!

Title: Durable, comfortable, all-weather
Review: This footwear fit my needs perfectly.  I was looking for all-weather, all-terrain footgear that is quick to put on and quick to take off.  Slip-on's were a must.  I use them for walking around outside my house, which means I'm walking in dirt, grass, on cement, on a wooden deck, and so forth.  I also use them for boating on a pontoon boat and for general, quick around-town use.  These clogs fit the bill perfectly.  They are durable, don't get dirty easily, are very easy to clean, and provide the foot with protection without stifling the foot.  I'm very satisfied with this product.  One caveat only - they wear a bit small in size for me, so I had to order a half-size larger than shoe size.  I'm a 10 1/2 in shoe size, and a size-11 croc fit perfectly.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2010

Title: Will continue to buy wish they lasted longer
Review: Used outdoors for barn work very comfortableGrips wear down to fast which results in them becoming slippery on wet surfaces they don’t last long enough before they need replacement
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2019

Title: Great Product!

These crocs are great and I plan to wear them all summer.

Title: Plantar fasciitis

I use them strictly in the house and I bought ortho inserts for my NB running sneakers. They say not to walk barefoot for a while but these crocs are nice in the house and easy to clean. I went to the doctors and got a inflammatory gel which is working great. I had plantar fasc for almost 6 mos in both feet. So with the combination of these three things I'm starting to feel better.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2013

Title: Feels great
Review: Gf said she’d leave me if I bought these. Said my soul would escape through the holes. I’m going to miss her. I enjoy wearing them with socks on. Minimizes the soul loss. I will update my review when I try them in 4WD (aka strap down).

Title: Comodidad
Review: La uso para mi trabajo en el hospital

Title: Fortunately the size imprint was still on the sole
Review: I purchased these to replace a pair of these I got about 8 years ago. Obviously, these things last forever. These cost 4 times as much as they did back then, but who could complain about that when you figure the lifespan. I, finally wore the bottoms completely smooth, which becomes hazardous on wet cement. I don't remember the insides being this bumpy as the new ones, maybe I wore those off too. Fortunately the size imprint was still on the sole, making ordering new ones simple. Size 10 is still size 10.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2015

Title: Love My Crocks

Title: CROCS ROCK
Review: I began wearing Crocs when I had my first bout with plantar fasciitis several years ago.  I don't know the hows or whys, but the Croc stabilizes my foot and gives support to help my feet not hurt.  I wear them around the house and occasionally when I go shopping.  But for every day wearing around the house shoe, there is nothing better for support and comfort.  My neighbor even thought my yellow ones were cool.  I like different colors and there are so many to chose from. My mom and dad began wearing Crocs also when they helped my feet.  They wear them every where.  Great shoe!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2014

Title: Buy them.
Review: Size & width are half size to full size larger & wider than usual.I'm 99% satisfied with these crocs. I've heard for years how out of this world comfy they. Finally got a pair. They are plenty comfortable. And so far the best little all around shoe ever had. Feet stay cool. As long as you're not doing any serious hiking or trying to use them for  water shoes. They get real slippery. All in all I'd recommend them.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2015

Title: Something east to slip on and off.

Title: End of feet cramps!
Review: I live in Crocs, as almost all other shoes hurt some part of my feet.  I liked the shine of these, rather than the dull finish I am used to.  My friend had crippling arthritis in both feet.  She had to give up all walking.  Her podiatrist told her she could not wear any shoes, ever, other than Crocs.  After she did that, she was able to resume her very long walks.  With that as an example, I wondered if Crocs would work for me - and find that they do.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2015

Title: If you have peripheral neuropathy--these shoes are for you!
Review: The peripheral neuropathy in my feet has become progressively worse--to the point where I was no longer able to wear stylish shoes. A friend recommended I try these, and after buying several pairs of "therapeutic" shoes for close to $100 each, I decided it was worth a try. What could I lose at this price? Thank goodness for her recommendation. These are the only shoes my feet can bear. I wear them to work every day (black and brown go with most clothes). I know this sounds melodramatic, but these shoes are the answer to my prayers!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2013

Title: If you already own crocs, mind the shoe size
Review: My girlfriend had an old pair of crocs, which I coveted.  So I finally decided to buy myself a pair on amazon. I based my size on the pair my GF had... which tended toward the small size.  As in: her lady size 9 fit my lady size 10 foot.  But when my new crocs arrived in the mail they were too small.  Should've ordered at 10. Which is my foot size.  Let this be a cautionary tale for you, weary traveler: Buy the shoe size you are, not the half-forgotten-dream of a shoe size your girlfriend wears.

Title: The rubberized insole & sole give enough cushion to help make walking comfortable --- nerve damage in my left leg & foot
Review: They're Crocs....  They slip right on & off w/o an issue.  The rubberized insole & sole give enough cushion to help make walking comfortable --- nerve damage in my left leg & foot.  I'd rather wear these than flip-flops or sandals.  Not the most fashionable thing to wear, but I'm doing yard work, going to Tae Kwon Do, walking the dog or getting groceries / Home Depot, so fashion isn't exactly on the top of my list there...  Functional?  Yep!  I'd buy these again.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2014

Title: Amazing Relaxing Shoes For Hiking and Camping!
Review:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   I never though about getting crocs until a good friend, who hikes days at a time in Yosemite every year takes crocs with him strapped to his trekking backpack. When I went with him this year I soon realized how awesome the crocs where. Whenever we camped or stopped by a river he would switch out his shoes and socks and slip on the crocs and off he went into the stream, river, or lake with no worries of stepping on rough rocks, sticks or whatever was underneath or rocks and boulders that are above the water. I didn't have any crocs at the time so I had to walk with my bare feet if I wanted to go in. They also made great camping shoes when setting up camp and just relaxing. Needless to say I was convinced and bought some for myself and my wife. We used them on a recent overnight hiking trip. Amazing shoes!
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2016

These Duet Sport Men's are longer and wider than the unisex. I usually wear an 8 women's wide and I think I could have used a 5 mens in these instead of the 6 but with socks they still fit. Will be buying more. I think the Duet Sport have a little more cushion than the regular crocs but both are comfortable.

Title: Great Shoes

Replace your old crocks and see what a difference it makes to have all the "new" features once again. I didn't realize how worn out my old pair were until the new ones arrived.

Title: Utilitarian Comfort

Too bad the public seems to find them hideous to look at, but I purchased them for around the house and garden anyway so I give them 5 stars. I am contemplating a second pair in black.

Title: Super Functional Footwear
Review: This is my second set of khaki Crocs, I love them. Perfect footwear around house, going to store, camping, beach even water parks. I have flat feet so minimal arch does not bother me, I have occasionally put orthotics in them for extra support (plenty of room), good cushioning in heel and ball of foot, I am a 14 EE and 14 M fit comfortably. I have several Crocs now, will almost certainly always own a few from now on. Only caveat is that they get slippery on smooth surfaces when bottoms gets worn, be careful transitioning from wet out doors to supermarket floors or other smooth surfaces (ATM, etc.)

Review: Same as Crocs sold in stores at the mall. Was glad I didn't have to drive 30 miles to get some! Fit is perfect; however, I wear custom-made orthotics, which slide out the back end (as the back isn't high enough to accommodate them); however, have found if I put 2 stapes from a staple gun straight down into the top of the back part of each shoe (side by side horizontally, but lift the staple up 1/16 of an inch after putting them in), this is just enough to hold the orthotics in, and the staples have not fallen out, even after walking or exercising. Would buy again!

Title: Crocs are just about the only footwear I can wear ...

This type of Crocs is my answer to my foot problem.

Title: My wife hates them...

With that said, I wear them all the time for everything else. They are on my feet from the time I wake up until I take them off and leave them by the foot of the bed.  On vacation, I even wear them as water shoes when I'm at the beach.  They are soft, comfortable and last forever.  While they aren't the most stylish or shoes. at my age ( 60 year old male) who cares?!Look, if you don't love Crocs, then you just don't get Crocs.  They are kind of quirky and the sizing charts are not standard.  but when you get a pair that fits, you'll understand what all the fuss is about.  You don't have to look at them, you just have to wear them!Love my CROCS.

Title: My first pair of Crocs and I love 'em!
Review: This is my first pair of Crocs and I love them!  I have a wide foot and comfort is key.  Crocs reminded me of the white "earth shoes" I wore back in the 70's & 80's while working in the medical field.  I remembered they weren't the most attractive shoes (looked like I had "duck feet") but they were comfortable.  I have friends that wear Crocs and decided to give them a try.  I usually wear an 8-1/2 or 9 and was torn between sizes.  Crocs recommends you order down to the next whole size if you are in-between sizes.  I ordered Classic Crocs / size W9 and I thought they were slightly longer than I needed so I ordered an 8 to be sure.  The length of the foot bed for the 8 was fine but I found the toe box to be a little snug on my littlest toe.  I kept the 9's and am glad I did.  I work in an office of a manufacturing plant with a casual dress code. Most of the building has concrete floors and the Crocs are just perfect for me.  I have since bought another pair in a different color and a pair of Crocs sandals.  The Classic Crocs clogs have ventilation so my feet don't get too hot like they might have in some of the closed styles.  I know Crocs have been around a long time and I don't know why it took me so long to try a pair.  I'm very happy I did.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2016

Title: Weightless, comfy, but tiny break in period
Review: Newbies: Wearing Crocs is not like wearing shoes. They weigh next to nothing and are cushiony without feeling spongy. Your feet don't have to 'grab' them to stay on: you walk effortlessly, even with the backstrap worn forward over your arch, like clogs. They are waterproof, so the shoes are great for gardening, and the ventilation holes will help your feet breathe; you don't have to wear socks, but I do to avoid any hint of sweaty feet. That's not a real problem for me, but feet vary.  After a short period of wearing them, they become even less noticeable as they conform to your feet. Two days later, most of you won't remember any problems, if you had them. Note: They will wear out eventually, especially if you wear them frequently on concrete. Replace them when the soles wear down, before they become dangerously slippery.Previous users: Remember that new Crocs won't fit like the old ones. The need time to adapt to your feet, particularly the backstrap, which will feel shorter at first.All: Khaki is a wonderful dust color for summer wear. Chocolate is not exactly milk chocolate or bittersweet. It's got a bit of green tinge, which makes it quite attractive for brown feet.

Title: Fantastic for swollen, pregnant feet
Review: I'm 7 months pregnant, and in the summer, my feet get very swollen.  I was down to 2 pair shoes that I could wear to work (closed toes shoes) and saw these on sale.  I was looking at Crocs for sometime, but was balking at the $34 price tag.  These were on sale, so I figured I might as well.  Oh, my fat feet are happy.  Good support, and they stretch with my feet throughout the day, so no pinching.  They do seem to shrink overnight, because they don't seem overly large the next day.  Obviously not very fashionable, but I was not looking for fashion, just shoes I could wear in semi-comfort.  I usually wear a 7.5/8 women's, and ordered these in a women's 8, which are fitting well.Additionally, at the end of the day if I need to slip on shoes for whatever reason, these are the only ones which I can stuff my feet into without pain, pinching, or having to try and bend down and adjust straps.  Would highly recommend to people who have swollen feet, looking for comfort and are willing to sacrifice a little fashion for a whole lot of comfort.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2016

Title: Very comfortable. Great for my intended uses to replace flip ...
Review: Very comfortable. Great for my intended uses to replace flip flops and to dry my feet out after walking around in boots or being wet all day.  However, the site suggested going up half a size if you are inbetween. I generally wear a 9.5 military boot or a 10 in regular shoes. I went with a 10, and the back strap barely catches on my heel as I take a step.  Fine for walking around on dry ground, indoors, at the pool etc.  However, it's a bit too large to walk around in muck, submerged water (creeks etc) because it just isn't tight enough.  If I purchased again I would actually go down half a size.
Review_Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2017
